	<item>
		<title>teacups</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2011/03/the-chi-tek-project/teacups/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 21 Mar 2011 11:38:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>

	<item>
		<title>Workshops</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/?page_id=3</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 22 Jan 2009 15:57:14 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?page_id=3</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[MzTEK workshops are for women attendees only.  

Our workshops cover a range of topics, from basic electronics to interactive technologies!  Hands-on, fun, and taught by genius (and patient) tutors, our workshops have mostly taken place in the recently refurbished media lab at [space] in Hackney, London.

You can find a list of pending workshops, tutorials, and general things we want to learn on our Wish List.  Chime in if there's something you want to learn!

If you are a working tutor or artist with teaching experience, and would like to pitch a workshop, please <a href="http://mztek.org/contact/">contact us</a> by email.


<h2>DATES FOR YOUR DIARY 2011</h2>

<h3> 22nd January</h3>
<ol><a href="http:/www.mztek.org/new-workshop-rfid-music-toy/">RFID Music Toy</a> Make a musical friend out of your favourite stuffed toy!</ol>


<h3>19th February</h3>
<ol><a href="http:/www.mztek.org/pacman-diy/">DIY PACMAN</a> Create LED light patterns for your own PACMAN game!</ol>


<h3>Dates TBC</h3> 	
<ol>Workshop: More Laser Cutting </ol>
<ol>GeekOut!</ol>

 <hr>


<em>Past workshops:</em>


<h3> 9th October 2010</h3>
<ol><a href="http:/www.mztek.org/autumn-geekout/">Autumn geekOut!</a></ol>


<h3>30th October 2010</h3>
<ol>Laser cutting your own design out of paper and card, amongst other things. This will take place at University of East London. More details to follow shortly.</ol>


<h3>27th November 2010</h3> 	
<ol>Workshop:  “Quick, dirty, botched & fun…how to get discarded machinery to do interesting things” more details to follow shortly. </ol>

<br />
<div class="workshop-thumb">
<a href="http:/www.mztek.org/sketchtag-programming-made-fun/" class="workshop-thumbs"><img class="size-thumbnail wp-image-641" title="Basic Electronics" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/picture-76.png" alt="sketchPatch" width="150" height="150" /></a><p class="thumb-caption">sketchPatch sketchTag</p></div>

<div class="workshop-thumb">

<div class="workshop-thumb">
<a  class="workshop-thumbs" href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/solarbots_flyer.jpg"><img class="size-thumbnail wp-image-540" title="solarbots_flyer" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/solarbots_flyer-150x150.jpg" alt="Solarbots" width="150" height="150" /></a><p class="thumb-caption">Solarbots</p></div>

	<item>
		<title>PEER-2-PEER</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/?page_id=5</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 22 Jan 2009 15:57:36 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?page_id=5</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[P2P is a ladies-only skills exchange.  Much more informal than the workshops, and free, we organize small informal tutorials where we can share skills we already possess.

If you would like to produce a P2P, we will help you sort out a space. <a href="http://mztek.org/contact">Get in touch with us</a> to find out more.
<h3>Previous P2P sessions</h3>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/htmlmail/arduinorama/arduinorama.html" target="_blank"></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/arduinorama.jpg"><img class="size-thumbnail wp-image-409 alignleft" title="arduinorama" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/arduinorama-150x150.jpg" alt="Arduinorama" width="150" height="150" /></a>

Arduinorama with Artemis:  An intro to tools used in toy hacking, installation art, and physical computing.

We'll explore:  basic electronics &amp; circuitry, intro to the Arduino, analog and digital outputs, potentiometers and buttons, basic sensors like light sensors, thermistors, and piezos.

Saturday, June 20, 11am - 2pm at [ SPACE ] 129-131 Mare Street, London

Supported by [ SPACE ]

<hr /><a href="http://www.mztek.org/http:/www.mztek.org/next-p2p-workshop-photoshop/">Photoshop Workshop</a>

The next Peer2 Peer workshop is going to be a  Photoshop workshop lead by Laura. Date for your diary... 14th MAY from 7pm - 9pm

the workshop will take place at SPACE media in Hackney
129 - 131 Mare St
Hackney
E8 3RH

<hr /><span class="status_body"><a href="http://www.mztek.org/http:/www.mztek.org/how-to-get-the-best-out-of-your-bittorrent/">How to get the best out of your BitTorrent:</a>
Thursday 26th March 7 - 9pm
Location: off Shoreditch High Street. email info@mztek.org for details.
We will provide the pizza!!</span>

Caroline will introduce:

BitTorrent
Choosing the best service
Safety - avoiding viruses and the law

Common downloaded File types &amp; how to play them
DIVX
ISO
RAR, TAR
Others

Premium newsgroups
Ripping streams
Ripping DVDs
mounting ISOs / virtual dives

And if there is anything else you know you don't know about this kind of thing, she is happy to take requests and suggestions for the workshop content. Email them to info(at)mztek.org

<hr /><a href="http://www.mztek.org/http:/www.mztek.org/experiments-in-interactive-video/">Experiments in Interactive Video</a>
Thursday 12th 7pm - 9pm - Venue: Southwark Park Club &amp; Institute Society, 386 Southwark Park Road, SE16 2ET. 10minute walk from Nearest Tube: Bermondsey, Jubilee Line.
<img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-155" title="isadora_nz_001_tn" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/03/isadora_nz_001_tn.jpg" alt="isadora_nz_001_tn" width="100" height="100" /> In this workshop we will make some funky visuals using live camera feed, pre-recorded video clips (feel free to bring your own... but make them small) and jpegs, (so bring some of those too). We will use sound and movement to trigger and manipulate visuals.

This workshop will involve some techy bits, like using a visual programming language, and it will also involve a bit of a boogie! Mary Clay is going to run a dance workshop for part of the session, and then we will combine the lot!

<hr /><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/01/wordpressmzteksm.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-685 alignleft" title="wordpressmzteksm" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/01/wordpressmzteksm.png" alt="wordpressmzteksm" width="176" height="61" /></a><strong>Customize A WordPress Theme</strong>:<strong> </strong>Sally will teach how to customize a WordPress theme (a little HTML, CSS, and PHP).  February 20th at 4pm.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Welcome to MzTEK!</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/?page_id=115</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 18 Feb 2009 21:27:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?page_id=115</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[MzTEK is an artist-led collective for women involved in media art. We're putting together a 3-month <a href="http://www.mztek.org/?page_id=3">programme</a> of workshops across topics like physical computing, cctv hacking, pervasive media, web fu and so on, and are looking for interested people to teach, who want to learn, or (hopefully) both. If this sounds interesting, get in touch.

Also on the plate is:

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/?page_id=7">MzTEK Unplugged</a>, a fortnightly gathering for techies and artists.  There'll be a short talk on something tech and art flavoured, and lots of time for chatting and beer. The idea is to learn something, meet people and enjoy.

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/?page_id=5">Peer 2 Peer</a>,  self organized workshops where members share their skills. Check the page for the upcoming workshop.

Watch this space for upcoming events and <a title="facebook group" href="http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=46702402694" target="_blank">join our Facebook group</a> and <a href="http://www.mztek.org/?page_id=9">sign up</a> for our mailing list.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2011/03/1095/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 20 Mar 2011 18:07:12 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=1095</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[MzTEK: women artists, techies and tinkerers


MzTEK is a nonprofit collective with the aim of encouraging women artists to pick up technical skills in the fields of new media, computer arts, and technology.

Based in London and supported by Hackney arts institution [ space ], we host a range of workshops, talks, and self-initiated tinker sessions.

Because we’re keen to provide a curriculum based on the needs and wants of the community, we host a “Wish List” — an open forum where you can post which classes you would love to take either to nurture your artistry, career, and curiosity.

Why not join our mailing list, if you’re keen to keep up with our doings?  We’ll keep you notified of our upcoming workshops and events.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2011/06/1360/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 19 Jun 2011 20:41:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=1360</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Chi-TEK is an exciting womens creative technology showcase initiated by MzTEK and running through 2011.  Chi-TEK will showcase technologically modified crockery from 17 leading women artists and designers who work in computer and new media arts today.

This playful take on the international institution of tea drinking celebrates pioneering women artists at the top of their game – and offers a tongue in cheek show case of what women can really achieve around a kitchen table.

The Chi-TEK project will run this autumn at the Victoria & Albert Museum Sackler Centre, in London, England, coinciding with the Crafts Council’s Power of Making and London Design Festivals.  The enhanced crockery will be on display from September through October 2011.

MzTek will also host crockery-themed technology workshops for women at the V&A and SPACE on the run up to Chi-TEK.  Join our mailing list or follow us via Twitter to keep up to date with upcoming events.
Participating Artists

	Mouna Androas & Melissa Mongiat (Montreal, Canada): Interaction Designers
	Sarah Angliss (Brighton): Sound Artist and Engineer
	Rain Ashford (London): Interactive electronic art and wearables Artist
	Katrin Baumgarten (London): Designer and Artist
	Tine Bech (London): Visual Artist
	Ilze Black and Girls Hack Lab – MAT Lab, Queen Mary University (London)
	Shu Lea Cheang (Paris): Multimedia Artist
	Anna Dumitriu (Brighton): Conceptual Artist
	Alexandra Deschamps-Sonsino (London): Industrial Designer, co-founded Tinker
	Julie Freeman (London): Performance and installation Artist
	Di Mainstone (London): Artist
	Syuzi Pakhchyan (Los Angeles, USA): Wearable Technology Design
	Artemis Papageorgiou (Athens, Greece): Installation Artist and Architect
	Mika Satomi (Tokyo/Sweden): Wearable Technology designer
	Eunjoo Shin (London): Media Artist
]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:6:{s:5:"width";s:3:"200";s:6:"height";s:3:"170";s:14:"hwstring_small";s:23:"height='96' width='112'";s:4:"file";s:27:"2012/06/gs_logo_bwSmall.jpg";s:5:"sizes";a:1:{s:9:"thumbnail";a:3:{s:4:"file";s:27:"gs_logo_bwSmall-150x150.jpg";s:5:"width";s:3:"150";s:6:"height";s:3:"150";}}s:10:"image_meta";a:10:{s:8:"aperture";s:1:"0";s:6:"credit";s:0:"";s:6:"camera";s:0:"";s:7:"caption";s:0:"";s:17:"created_timestamp";s:1:"0";s:9:"copyright";s:0:"";s:12:"focal_length";s:1:"0";s:3:"iso";s:1:"0";s:13:"shutter_speed";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:0:"";}}]]></wp:meta_value>

	<item>
		<title>About</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/about</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 10 Dec 2008 20:07:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org//?page_id=2</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[MzTEK is a nonprofit collective with the aim of encouraging women artists to pick up technical skills in the fields of new media, computer arts, and technology.

Based in London and supported by Hackney arts institution <a href="http://www.spacemedia.org.uk/" target="_blank">[ space ]</a>, and <a title="Centre for Creative Collaboration" href="http://www.creativecollaboration.org.uk/" target="_blank">Centre for Creative Collaboration</a> in Kings Cross, where we are located, we host a range of <a href="http://www.mztek.org/workshops/">workshops</a>, talks, and self-initiated <a href="http://www.mztek.org/peer-meet/">tinker sessions</a>.

<object width="400" height="320" classid="clsid:d27cdb6e-ae6d-11cf-96b8-444553540000" codebase="http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0"><param name="allowfullscreen" value="true" /><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always" /><param name="src" value="http://vimeo.com/moogaloop.swf?clip_id=9226266&amp;server=vimeo.com&amp;show_title=1&amp;show_byline=1&amp;show_portrait=0&amp;color=&amp;fullscreen=1" /><embed width="400" height="320" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" src="http://vimeo.com/moogaloop.swf?clip_id=9226266&amp;server=vimeo.com&amp;show_title=1&amp;show_byline=1&amp;show_portrait=0&amp;color=&amp;fullscreen=1" allowfullscreen="true" allowscriptaccess="always" /></object>

Because we’re keen to provide a curriculum based on the needs and wants of the community, we host a <a href="http://www.mztek.org/wish-list">"Wish List"</a> — an open forum where you can post which classes you would love to take either to nurture your artistry, career, and curiosity.

Why not join our <a href="http://mztek.org/mailman/listinfo/allsubscribers_mztek.org">mailing list</a>, if you're keen to keep up with our doings? We'll keep you notified of our upcoming workshops and events.
<h2>Organisers</h2>
<em>Sophie McDonald </em>is a media artist, freelance workshop producer, video editor, and educator.  Her work includes the online programming platform <a title="Sketch Patch" href="http://www.sketchPatch.net" target="_blank">www.sketchPatch.net</a>.

<em>Emilie Giles</em> completed her MA at Goldsmiths in Interactive Media: Critical Theory and Practice. She currently works for social video distributors Unruly Media, as a Marketing and Events Co-ordinator.

<em>Sally Northmore</em> previously worked in New York City in event planning, electronic initiatives and production in publishing.  She is currently a web developer at SHOWstudio.com in London.

&nbsp;
<h2>Board of Directors</h2>
Sarah Angliss
Julie Freeman
Ilze Black
Gini Simpson
Lisa Haskel
Anab Jain
Sara Heitlinger]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>MzTEK Unplugged</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/programs/unplugged/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 22 Jan 2009 15:57:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?page_id=7</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Hosting a range of speakers who practice computer art, new media art, activism, curation, and promotion, <strong>Unplugged</strong> is designed as an opportunity to shut our laptops for an evening, and draw on the skills and experience of the media arts community.  Come join us for a drink and some interesting conversation!

Unplugged gathers fortnightly through June 2009, and is open to the public.  Free.

<strong>We're excited to host the following confirmed speakers:</strong>
<div class="speaker"><a href="http://www.mztek.org/http:/www.mztek.org/mztek-unplagged-lisa-haskel/">Lisa Haskel</a>
18th March 2009

<img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-210" title="Lisa Haskel" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/03/1.jpg" alt="Lisa Haskel" width="166" height="166" />

Lisa has worked with media artists over 20 years or so, originally as an organiser/administrator, and more recently giving technical support and teaching the technical fundamentals of creative work on the web including networking, programming and server administration.

Lisa will showcase examples of student projects she have supported to open up a discussion on the importance (or otherwise) of programming knowledge for media artists, and strategies for gaining these skills.

7pm - 9pm at <a href="www.fancyapint.com/pubs/pub3822.html">The Brittannia Pub</a> (44 Kipling Street, SE1 3RU)</div>
<div class="speaker"><a href="http://www.mztek.org/http:/www.mztek.org/ruth-catlow/">Ruth Catlow</a>
1st April 2009

Ruth will talk about Furtherfield.org, an independent media arts
organisation that provides contexts and platforms for creating, viewing,
discussing and learning about experimental practices at the intersection
of art, technology and social change.

<a href="http://www.furtherfield.org">www.furtherfield.org</a>
<a href="http://www.http.uk.net">www.http.uk.net</a></div>
<div class="speaker"><a href="http://www.mztek.org/http:/www.mztek.org/mztek-unplugged-alex-zivanovic/">Alex Zivanovic</a>
15th April 2009

Alex  will talk about the creative uses of Physical Computing - sensing and controlling the real world using programmable microcontrollers. In particular, he will talk about the Arduino (<a href="http://www.arduino.cc">www.arduino.cc</a>), a low cost microcontroller system specifically aimed at artists and designers. He'll show how the system can be used to make interactive devices and installations.

Alex has a background in engineering, but is increasingly working in the art and design fields. He is a visiting tutor at the Royal College of Art and Goldsmiths. His particular interest is in physical computing and interactive robotics as art installations.

<a href="http://www.zivanovic.co.uk">www.zivanovic.co.uk</a></div>
<div class="speaker"><a href="http://www.mztek.org/http:/www.mztek.org/mztek-unplugged-julie-freeman/">Julie Freeman</a>
29th April 2009

<img class="alignleft" title="Catching Tagged Fish" src="http://www.juliefreeman.co.uk/lake/img/photos/02_catching.jpg" alt="" width="138" height="138" /> Julie will introduce the politics of Open Source software and code, and will introduce some of the useful programs, packages and tools available for artists, and tools she uses in her work.</div>
<div class="speaker"><a href="http://www.mztek.org/http:/www.mztek.org/mztek-unplugged-alex-mclean/">Alex McLean</a>
13 May 2009

<img class="alignleft" src="http://yaxu.org/knitting.jpg" alt="" width="200" height="250" />Alex will talk about the nature of code, of geometrical space, and the relationship between them.  This will lead into a demo of vocable synthesis, a way of controlling synthesized drums with words.

Alex is one third of the live coding band <a href="http://slub.org/" target="_blank">http://slub.org</a>, a PhD student at Goldsmiths digital studios and co-organiser of various events including dorkbotlondon.  He enjoys computer programming as a way of making music and of interacting with the world.  More info about his projects and activities may be found at <a href="http://yaxu.org/" target="_blank">http://yaxu.org/</a></div>
<div class="speaker"><a href="http:/www.mztek.org/mztek-unplugged-sarah-angliss/">Sarah Angliss</a>
27th May 2009
<img src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/01/spacedogfiling3.jpg" alt="spacedogfiling3" title="spacedogfiling3" width="120" height="141" class="alignleft size-full wp-image-392" />
Better living through ALife
Sound artist, engineer and semi-competent programmer Sarah Angliss (Spacedog UK) shares a handful of cunningly simple tricks, inspired by animals, that can be used to make your exhibits, programs and anything else you can dream of more sublime. Use 'bee vision' to track small moving objects with very little computing power. Borrow some ideas from Darwian evolution to solve problems at great speed. Give people the impression you've made a really intelligent robot, when there's very little 'under the hood'. Sarah is coming fresh from her music and automata show Electroplasm at the Brighton festival fringe, where she performed to rave reviews - you can also see her performing, tonight, for free at the Science Museum Late (20 May).
</div>
<div class="speaker"><a href="http://www.mztek.org/http:/www.mztek.org/next-unplugged-ilze-black-wed-3rd-june-7-9pm/">Ilze Black</a>
3rd June 2009
Come and chill out with a cool beer and have a chat with new media artist and producer Ilze Black.

Ilze will talk about her work as media artist and producer. She has curated numerous media productions, art events and happenings in and around London during last 10 years. In 1990s post-Soviet Latvia, Ilze helped to set up the
seminal art initiative art bureau OPEN, and staged seminal events like Open, Biosport and the Untitled: subvertising session in the streets of Riga. In 2003 Ilze Co-founded new media society Take2030. Her projects focus on network populism, free wireless, open communities and transnational society.

Ilze is currently media arts curator at <a href="http://www.watermans.org.uk">Watermans art centre</a> London and is an associate of <a href="http://hivenetworks.net/tiki-view_articles.php">HiveNetworks</a>, <a href="http://www.claswargames.net">Class Wargames</a> and <a href="http://www.nodel.org/">Node.London</a>.
</div>
<div class="speaker"><a href="http://www.mztek.org/http:/www.mztek.org/mztek-unplugged-ele-carpenter/">Ele Carpenter</a>
17 June 2009
<img class="alignleft" src="http://www.open-source-embroidery.org.uk/osepics/Patchworkviewer.jpg" alt="" width="136" height="167" />Ele will talk about her current research project <a href="http://www.elecarpenter.org.uk/">Open Source Embroidery.</a> Please feel free to bring along your knitting and coding patterns  to share and modify.
The Open Source Embroidery project was initiated by Ele Carpenter in 2005. The project has grown to support and facilitate a range of artists practice investigating the relationship between programming for embroidery and computing. It’s based on the common characteristics of needlework crafts and open source computer programming: gendered obsessive attention to detail; shared social process of development; and a transparency of process and product. Open Source Embroidery is a socially engaged art project developed through workshops and an email list: os-embroidery@googlegroups.com There are also groups on Facebook and Flickr.

Ele’s blog Ele Weekend documents the project and posts information about current workshops and exhibitions.

Ele Carpenter is an independent curator and researcher based in Umea in Northeast Sweden, Newcastle upon Tyne and London, UK. She is currently undertaking a Research Fellowship at HUMlab in affiliation with the BildMuseet at the University of Umea, Sweden. Her curatorial practice responds to specific socio-political cultural contexts in collaboration with individuals, groups and organisations. Her life-long interest in the relationship between creativity and political action, has been influenced by her formative years at Greenham Common Women’s Peace Camp and on Cruisewatch. Fleeing the polarities of activism to join the art-world, she has continuously interrogated the relationship between cultural and political change through curatorial creative practice. Her research has written, curatorial and creative outcomes including mapping, embroidery, and research projects on this website.


</div>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/?p=358&amp;preview=true">Jim Prevett</a>
24th June2009

Jim Prevett studied Fine Art (Sculpture) at Sheffield Hallam University in 1999. He works with prevett &amp; mcArthur who have exhibited across the UK and internationally including 'Echo City' at the British Pavilion for Venice Biennale of Architecture 2006, The Perfect Real at King Street Arts Centre and ‘His life is full of miracles…' videotech at Site Gallery Sheffield. Jim ran the arts programme for Access Space in Sheffield for 2 years establishing a residency programme and producing LOSS Livecode, a festival of 'livecoding' audio. Access Space is the UK’s first recycled technology medialab, using open source software to invigorate old computers and creativity using computers. Jim has worked with Encounters community based arts organisation in Sheffield and as part of New Dust.

Jim currently works as the Emergent Technologies Producer at SPACE media in Hackney, where he runs programmes such as the PermaCultures series of residencies and workshops and FutureTV youth media development. He is an Associate Lecturer on the undergraduate Fine Art (media) course at at Sheffield Hallam University. Jim lives and works in London and Sheffield.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Wish List &lt;3 &lt;3 &lt;3</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/wish-list/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 18 Feb 2009 21:41:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?page_id=121</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Welcome to the Wish List.  We're opening up a comment-style forum where you can add and bounce ideas, thoughts, and suggestions for course material.

Why not chime in and put in your two cents?  We'll try to match a tutor to your course wish, although suggestions/recommendations are always a help.

With the help of Space Studios and our co-organizers, we are actively  recruiting tutors for specialty workshops ranging the new media gamut. If you are a tutor and would like to propose a course or workshop, please contact us by <a title="Email MzTek" href="mailto:info@mztek.org">email</a>.

<strong>Suggested / Requested courses:</strong>

<strong>* Toy Hacking/Physical Computing</strong><strong></strong>

<strong>* CCTV Hacking</strong><strong></strong>

<strong>* Processing</strong><strong></strong>

<strong>* RFID Tags</strong>
<strong>* Using sensors: Arduinos, stamps</strong>

<strong>* Pervasive media / Ubiquitous Computing</strong>

<strong>*Arduinos</strong><strong></strong>

<strong>*Pure Data / Max
</strong><strong></strong>

<strong>*Gaming Tools
</strong>

<strong>*3D Game Design</strong>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>unplugged schedule with table html</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/test-unplugged/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 06 Mar 2009 13:38:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?page_id=188</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[MzTEK Unplugged is be a series of invited speakers, in computer and new-media arts, activism, curators and promoters to present their work in an informal round the table discussion group.  These sessions will be open to the public, and are designed as an opportunity for MzTEK to draw on all the skills and experiences of the media arts community.

Living up to its name, Unplugged is a chance for MzTEK-ers to put away their laptops for an evening and learn how others do it!

Open to the public // Free

<strong>Confirmed speakers</strong>
<table border="0">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td><a href=" ">Lisa Haskel</a>
18th March 2009

<img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-210" title="Lisa Haskel" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/03/1.jpg" alt="Lisa Haskel" width="166" height="166" />

Lisa will use examples of student projects she have supported to open up a
discussion on the importance (or otherwise) of programming knowledge
for media artists, and strategies for gaining these skills.

…………………………………………………………………………..</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="http://www.mztek.org/http:/www.mztek.org/ruth-catlow/">
Ruth Catlow</a>
1st April 2009

Ruth will be talking about Furtherfield.org, an independent media arts
organisation that provides contexts and platforms for creating, viewing,
discussing and learning about experimental practices at the intersection
of art, technology and social change.
<a href="http://www.furtherfield.org">www.furtherfield.org</a>
<a href="http://www.http.uk.net">www.http.uk.net</a>
…………………………………………………………………………..</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href=" ">Alex Zivanovic</a>
15th April 2009

…………………………………………………………………………..</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="http://www.mztek.org/http:/www.mztek.org/mztek-unplugged-julie-freeman/">Julie Freeman</a>
29th April 2009

<img class="alignleft" title="Catching Tagged Fish" src="http://www.juliefreeman.co.uk/lake/img/photos/02_catching.jpg" alt="" width="138" height="138" /> Julie will be introducing the politics of Open Source software and code, and will introduce some of the useful programs, packages and tools available for artists, and tools she uses in her work

<span style="color: #000000;">.</span>

<span style="color: #000000;">.</span>

<span style="color: #000000;">.</span>

<span style="color: #000000;">.</span>

…………………………………………………………………………..</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href=" ">Alex McLean</a>
13th May 2009</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href=" ">?</a>
27th May 2009</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href=" ">Jim Prevett</a>
3rd June 2009</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="http://www.mztek.org/http:/www.mztek.org/mztek-unplugged-ele-carpenter/">Ele Carpenter</a>
17 June 2009
<div><img class="alignleft" src="http://www.open-source-embroidery.org.uk/osepics/Patchworkviewer.jpg" alt="" width="136" height="167" />Ele will be talking about her current research project <a href="http://www.elecarpenter.org.uk/">Open Source Embroidery.</a> Please feel free to bring along your knitting and coding patterns  to share and modify.</div></td>
</tr>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Chi-TEK</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/programs/chi-tek/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 24 Sep 2010 12:25:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?page_id=769</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Chi-TEK combines Art, Technology and Tea in an exciting new showcase of technologically-modified teapots, by 20 leading women artists and designers working in computer and new media arts today.

Chi-TEK will run events and workshops, including a giant tea party, this autumn in a celebration of what women are achieving in media and technology arts today. Chi-TEK offers a tongue in cheek take on what women can really achieve around a kitchen table.

The Chi-TEK Tea Party, will display the teapots in full working order in the V&amp;A garden as part of London Design Festival Digital Weekend, on the 24th &amp; 25th September. Come along and chat to the artists whilst enjoying tea and cake.

We will also be running Chi-TEK tea related workshops for women, at [ space ] and the V&amp;A, as well as 'Chi-TEK Fest', a day of workshops and tinkering in October, in collaboration with School of Everything.

We have had amazing support towards the costs of delivering Chi-TEK and would like to say BIG THANK YOU to all those that have contributed. Please take a moment to see <a href="http://www.mztek.org/programs/chi-tek/support">our supporters page</a>.

<a href="http://mztek.org/mailman/listinfo/allsubscribers_mztek.org">Join our mailing list</a> or follow us via <a title="MzTEK Tweets" href="http://twitter.com/mztek">Twitter</a> to keep up to date with upcoming events.
<h2 style="text-align: center;"><a title="Participating Artists" href="http://www.mztek.org/programs/chi-tek/participating-artists/">Read all about the Chi-TEK artists</a></h2>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Workshop Material</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/workshop-material/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 01 Nov 2010 09:37:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?page_id=902</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Course material from MzTEK workshops:

<hr size="1" style="color:#FFFFFF" />

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/2009/09/solarbots/">SOLARBOTS</a>  workshop by <a href="http://varvarag.cdrews.de/">Varvara Guljajeva</a>
Workshop pdf can be downloaded <a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/11/solarbots.pdf">HERE</a>

<hr size="1" style="color:#FFFFFF" />

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/2009/12/workshop-basic-electronics/">Electronics for Absolute Beginners</a> by <a href="http://www.lushprojects.com/">Iain Sharp</a> 
The workshop pdf can be downloaded <a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/11/electronics-for-absolute-beginners-r4.pdf">HERE</a>

<hr size="1" style="color:#FFFFFF" />

Laser Cutting workshop by Toby Borland
The workshop materials can be downloaded <a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/11/laser_cutter_intro.pdf">HERE</a>

<hr size="1" style="color:#FFFFFF" />

<a href="http://www.sketchpatch.net"> sketchPatch </a> by Sophie McDonald 
The workshop slides can be downloaded   <a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/11/sp-workshop-basicslides.pdf">HERE</a>

<hr size="1" style="color:#FFFFFF" />

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/2011/04/workshop_future-everything/">DIY PACMAN</a> by <a href="http://www.ejoo.org/">Eunjoo Shin</a>
The workshop pdf can be downloaded <a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/11/DIY-PACMAN_MzTEK.pdf">HERE</a>

<hr size="1" style="color:#FFFFFF" />


<a href="http://www.mztek.org/2011/02/programming/">MzTEK Guide to Programming</a> by <a href="http://theleadingzero.com/">Becky Stewart</a>
Workshop material can be downloaded in three parts
Download Part 1 pdf <a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/11/mztekprogramming-110315075234-phpapp02.pdf">HERE</a>
Download Part 2 pdf <a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/11/mztekprogramming2-110327124258-phpapp01.pdf">HERE</a>
Download Part 3 pdf <a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/11/mztekprogramming3-110403131917-phpapp02.pdf">HERE</a>

<hr size="1" style="color:#FFFFFF" />

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/2011/03/shiver-my-teacups/">Shiver My Teacups!</a> by <a href="http://katrinbaumgarten.de/">Katrin Baumgarten</a>
The Workshop pdf can be downloaded <a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/11/tea-workshop-handout-by-KBaumgarten.pdf">HERE</a>

There were two elements to this workshop, using a temperature sensor and using a proximity sensor. The code for both can be found below...

// temprature sensor triggers small motor

const int motor_vibration_pin = 2;
const int temperature_pin = 3;

const int trigger_temp = 39;   // temperature at which we want to activate the vibrator
const int vibration_duration = 60; // seconds

boolean activated = false;

void setup()
{
    pinMode(motor_vibration_pin, OUTPUT);
    digitalWrite(motor_vibration_pin, LOW);
    Serial.begin(9600); // start serial communication

}

void loop()
{
    int current_temp = ( 5.0 * analogRead(temperature_pin) * 100.0) / 1024.0;

    Serial.print("Current temperature: ");

    Serial.print(current_temp,DEC);
    Serial.println(" Celsius");

    if (activated == false)
    {
        if (current_temp > trigger_temp + 2) 
        {
            activated = true;
            Serial.println("5 Degrees above trigger temperature, starting to pay attention!");

        }
    }
    else
    {
        if (current_temp < trigger_temp)
        {
            Serial.println("Temperature falling below trigger temperature! Activate the MOTORRRRR!");

            digitalWrite(motor_vibration_pin, HIGH);
            delay(vibration_duration * 1000);       // in milliseconds, 10000ms = 10 seconds
            digitalWrite(motor_vibration_pin, LOW);
            activated = false;
            Serial.println("Done. Waiting for higher temperature again.");
        }
    }
    delay(1000);
}


// Distance triggered saucer vibrator

const int motor_vibration_pin = 2;
const int distance_pin = 3;

const int trigger_dist = 400;   // distance at which we want to activate the vibrator

void setup()
{
  pinMode(motor_vibration_pin, OUTPUT);
  digitalWrite(motor_vibration_pin, LOW);
  Serial.begin(9600); // start serial communication

}

void loop()
{
  int current_dist = analogRead(distance_pin);
  Serial.print("Current dist: ");
  Serial.println(current_dist);

  if (current_dist > trigger_dist)       
  {
    Serial.println("Distance falling below trigger distance! Activate the MOTORRRRR!");
    digitalWrite(motor_vibration_pin, HIGH);
  }
  else
  {
    Serial.println("Distance above trigger distance! Switching off the MOTORRRRR!");
    digitalWrite(motor_vibration_pin, LOW);      
  }
  delay(100);
}


<hr size="1" style="color:#FFFFFF" />]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Artists Registration</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/programs/chi-tek/register/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 19 Feb 2011 13:22:03 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Hello Artist! Please take a few minutes to register your information with us for the CHI-TEK project. We will be in touch shortly with more information and technical details. Thank you, MzTEK</p>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Artists Information</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/artists-information/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 16 Mar 2011 11:27:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="text-align: right;"><em>Updated 23 August 2011</em></p>
Check back here for updated information and details on the <a href="http://www.mztek.org/programs/chi-tek/">Chi-TEK project</a>.  Please feel free to <a title="Email MzTEK" href="mailto:info@mztek.org">email us directly</a> with any technical questions.
<h2>The Reception Dinner</h2>
You are all warmly invited to a Chi-TEK welcome dinner, on Friday 23rd September, 8pm - 10pm.   The dinner will be in the dome room at the crafty tea rooms,  <a href="http://www.drinkshopdo.com/" target="_blank">Drink, Shop &amp; Do</a> near Kings Cross. Dinner will be provided by MzTEK for Chi-TEK artists and special invited guests from the V&amp;A and SPACE.
<h2>Tea Party</h2>
Please come to the V&amp;A's John Madejski garden for 10:30am sharp, unless we have asked you to arrive at 9.30.

The exhibit is open to the public from 11am - 4.30pm as a drop-in event both days.

All of the artist teapots will be on display in full working order.  As one of our contributing artists we would love you to come and be able to present your teapot to the public over the weekend.

Artists are required to be around for the day to chat to the public and demonstrate their projects. We will also have a schedule of events including an intro to Chi-TEK, artists intro's, and prize draw, which we will publish at least one week before the event.

The public will be given tea and cake by the V&amp;A to enjoy in the Chi-TEK tea party.

<strong>Summery:</strong>
<strong> 10.30 - Arrive</strong>
<strong> 11.00 - Open</strong>
<strong> 4.30 - Close</strong>
<strong> 5.30 - Swift half (optional)</strong><span style="font-size: x-large;"><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-size: 22px; line-height: 32px;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;">
</span></span></span></span>
<h2>Showcase</h2>
The teapots go on display at the V&amp;A Sackler Centre Art Room, and will be displayed in a glass cabinet. Unfortunately it is not possible to have the tea pots in working order in the cabinet.  We will be focusing publicity towards the tea party weekend.

The showcase opens on 7th September through November 2011, and will coincide with the Digital festival and Crafts Council’s Makers fair.
<h2><strong>Dates to Remember:</strong></h2>
<strong>23rd September: </strong>Evening reception dinner from 8.00 - 10pm, at Drink, Shop and Do.<strong>
</strong><strong>24 &amp; 25 September</strong>:  CHI-TEK Tea Party in the gardens of the Victoria &amp; Albert Museum
<strong><strong>22bd October:</strong></strong>  Chi-TEK FEST, Workshop day delivered by some Chi-TEK Artists.
<h2>Video, photographs, blogs and things</h2>
<strong></strong>Now you have hacked / reconfigure / modify your teapot and documented your process.  Please let us have your footage, photographs, videos, and/or diagrams to illustrate your process. We will be running a short, 3min video of all the tea pots working on a video screen in the cabinet with your tea pots. We would also like to keep as much documentation about the project as possible, to make some short films.  If you have a mo, we would love a blog post for our website describing your process and interest in the Chi-TEK project.
<h2>After Chi-TEK</h2>
<h2>Returns</h2>
Lastly, at the end of the exhibit (end of November), a selection of the exhibit may go on display at other locations. If you would prefer we returned your work to you, we will do so by post.
<h2>Invoicing</h2>
There is a commission/materials fee of £100 for each tea pot.

There is an attendance fee for the 24th &amp; 25th, of £100 per day.

You are welcome to invoice for the materials fee now, or if you prefer, and are attending the tea party, you can invoice for everything in one go after the 26th September.

Please include your bank sort code and account number in your invoice, and send your invoice to:

MzTEK
28 Wrayburn House
Llewellyn Street
London
SE16 4XA
UK]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Programs</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/programs/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 20 Mar 2011 18:05:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?page_id=1092</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[MzTEK provides short courses, workshops, geek-outs and other events for women on all sorts of topics, at a low cost.  Our classes provide mostly technical training in an arts context, ranging from basic electronics and circuitry to more advanced courses in programming and prototyping.
<h2>See what's coming up in <a href="http://www.mztek.org/calendar">our events calendar</a></h2>
<h2><a href="http://www.mztek.org/category/events/workshops/">Workshops</a></h2>
<a href="/category/events/workshops/">View a list of past and upcoming workshops</a>.  We provide a <a title="The Wish List" href="/wish-list/">Wish List</a> on our site where we pool for ideas on topics and skills that our students want to learn.  Most of our programming is based on this list, so please feel free to add to it if you are interested in attending our programs.

Materials for past workshops can be found on our <a href="http://www.mztek.org/workshop-material/">Workshop Material</a> page
<h2><a href="/tag/geek-out/">Geek Outs</a></h2>
MzTEK Geek outs are informal gatherings where you can come to experiment with our kit, meet other women tinkerers, or seek help on projects you’re working on.<a href="/tag/geek-out/"> List of past Geek Outs</a>.
<h2><a href="/programs/chi-tek/">Chi-TEK</a></h2>
<a href="/programs/chi-tek/">Chi — Computer Human Interaction — TEK</a> is a project that will run from April through October 2011 in collaboration with the Victoria &amp; Albert Museum.  Including workshops, a small exhibition and weekend event, <a href="/programs/chi-tek/">Chi-TEK</a> is a playful take on the international institution of tea drinking, and celebrates pioneering women artists at the top of their game – and offers a tongue in cheek show case of what women can really achieve around a kitchen table.
<h2><a href="/programs/unplugged/">Unplugged</a></h2>
In Spring 2009, MzTEK ran <a title="Unplugged" href="/programs/unplugged/">a series of talks</a> with artists, curators, and technologists in London.  Informal, fun, and short, this successful project brought a wide range of hackers, tinkerers, and artists together around a table to discuss their craft.]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Raffle to Win a Place on Shiver My Teacup</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/?page_id=1224</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 26 Mar 2011 19:28:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>becky</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?page_id=1224</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[ Would you like to register for the <a href="http://www.mztek.org/2011/03/shiver-my-teacups/">Shiver My Teacup</a> for as little as £3?  Buy a raffle ticket for a chance to win free registration -  an £80 value!

To enter, just give us some details below and pay £3 via Paypal by clicking below on the Pay Now button.  (To purchase multiple raffle tickets, donate £3 x the number of tickets you would like.  Each ticket has an equal chance to win, more tickets means more chances.  Your odds of winning are dependent on the number of tickets you purchase and the total number of tickets purchased.)

<strong>We will draw a winner 5 April.</strong>  If we have not received your payment by the time of the draw, you will not be eligible and will not be entered into the contest.  Anyone can enter the drawing, but only women can attend the workshop.  The winner can transfer the free workshop registration to someone else if they cannot attend themselves.

<form action="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr" method="post" target="_blank">
<input type="hidden" name="cmd" value="_s-xclick">

	<item>
		<title>The Artists</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/programs/chi-tek/participating-artists/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 28 Jun 2011 21:13:48 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Em</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?page_id=1320</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h2><span style="color: #000000;">Mouna Andraos &amp; Melissa Mongiat</span></h2>
<span style="color: #000000;"><strong><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/andraos_mongiat_capsule_portrait1.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1529 alignleft" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/andraos_mongiat_capsule_portrait1-300x225.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="225" /></a></strong></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong></strong>Mouna Andraos and Melissa Mongiat work at the intersection of participation, design and technology -- researching new ways to interact and tell stories and empowering people to have a place in the stories that are told around them. In the summer of 2011, they created a set of 21 musical swings for the city of Montreal's, a singing machine that will go on tour throughout  Quebec and a Giant Sing Along for the Minnesota State Fair.</span>

<span style="color: #000000;">Mouna holds a Masters degree from New York University and is an alumni of Eyebeam Center for Art and Technology in New York City.  She has shown work and lead workshops in various locations including at the 01SJ Biennale and Beirut's Olympiades culturelles. Her web-based work has awards ranging from a Best of Show at the SXSW Festival to a CyberLion in Cannes. Melissa's is an MA graduate from Central Saint Martins College. Her </span>
<span style="color: #000000;"> series of public interactive installations created for London's Southbank Centre led to her selection by Wallpaper* magazine as one of the world's ten breakthrough designers. Her research work on participatory design with Kelsey Snook has been presented notably the  Banff New Media Institute and the Instituto di Diseno Europeo in Barcelona, and led to the creation of GoodParticipation.com.</span>

<span style="color: #000000;"> Mouna and Melissa we awarded the Phyllis Lambert Design prize in 2010.</span>

<a href="http://livingwithourtime.com/"><span style="color: #99cc00;">http://livingwithourtime.com</span></a>
<h2><span style="color: #000000;">Sarah Angliss</span></h2>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/SarahAnglissThereminArchGaynorPerry.jpg"><span style="color: #000000;"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1488 alignleft" title="Photo by Gaynor Perry" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/SarahAnglissThereminArchGaynorPerry-300x200.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="200" /></span></a><span style="color: #000000;">An award-winning sound artist and maker, Sarah Angliss (aka Spacedog) is known for her dreamlike performances, incorporating theremin and her uncanny musical robots which accompany her live on stage. </span>

<span style="color: #000000;">Trained in electroacoustics, music and robotics, Sarah is also an historian whose work often reflects her discoveries in the archives. The Ealing Feeder, for example, is a robotic carillon inspired by an electric lullaby she discovered in the archives of the Electrical Association for Women c1930. And her recent Spacedog show Televisor uses a robotic vent doll and flickering Nipkow disk projections to summon the spirit of John Logie Baird. Other work has explored Lancashire clog dancing as early noise music (with Caroline Radcliffe); musicians’ attitudes to the first drum machines and samplers (the subject of her recent TEDx talk); the uncanny valley; the history of dead air and the reputed psychological effects of infrasound. </span>

<span style="color: #000000;">Sarah’s world-renowned collaboration Infrasonic (May 2002) led to a new special effect, in collaboration with Punchdrunk, which debuted in It Felt Like a Kiss, Manchester International Festival 2009. In July 2011, BBC Radio 4 broadcast her documentary on the use of birds as primordial, feathered sound recorders.</span>

<a href="http://www.sarahangliss.com"><span style="color: #99cc00;">http://www.sarahangliss.com</span></a>
<h2><span style="color: #000000;">Rain Ashford</span></h2>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/rain_ears.jpg"><span style="color: #000000;"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1322" style="margin-top: 2; margin-right: 10; margin-bottom: 4;" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/rain_ears-225x300.jpg" alt="" width="225" height="300" align="left" /></span></a><span style="color: #000000;"> I've been working in the digital field for 14 years, creating both screen based and physical interactive work. My interactive wearable and artworks include musical and gaming aspects in various media such as: Arduino, mbed, e-textiles, electroluminescent wire, C programming language, Flash, old skool Director and JavaScript.</span>

<span style="color: #000000;">I'm fascinated by Harajuku Japanese street fashion, especially Gothic Lolita and its variations, which has influenced me to create my own variant on this fashion: "Neon-Victoriana", which includes the use of electroluminescent materials and electronic modules.</span>

<span style="color: #000000;">In 2011, I've so far exhibited at Maker Faire UK, Newcastle and Kinetica Art Fair, London, plus spoken about my work at Opentech. In previous years, I've exhibited at London's ICA, Brighton Fringe Festival, Fabrica and New York SVA, I created the Digital Art galleries for BBC /Arts and also co-organised a digital arts exhibition at the UK's legendary Lux gallery in Hoxton.</span>

<a href="http://rainycatz.wordpress.com/"><span style="color: #99cc00;">http://rainycatz.wordpress.com</span></a>
<h2><span style="color: #000000;">Katrin Baumgarten</span></h2>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/katrinbaumgarten.jpg"><span style="color: #000000;"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1326" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/katrinbaumgarten-300x225.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="225" /></span></a><span style="color: #000000;">Katrin Baumgarten holds an MA from the Royal College of Art and an MSc from Imperial College London in Innovation Design Engineering. Her projects revolve around human-technology interaction and explore future possibilities within technology and art. She loves to see the magic that appears when an inanimate object suddenly starts to move and respond to external stimuli in ways normally attributed to humans.</span>

<a href="http://katrinbaumgarten.de/"><span style="color: #99cc00;">http://katrinbaumgarten.de</span></a>
<h2><span style="color: #000000;">Tine Bech</span></h2>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/TineBech_Portait.jpg"><span style="color: #000000;"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1327" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/TineBech_Portait-300x157.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="157" /></span></a><span style="color: #000000;">Tine Bech is a visual artist and researcher who works with interactive artwork and public art. Her work is concerned with audience engagement and aims to create experiences of immersion and play. The work is intentionally accessible through the use of location and materials such as interactive electronics and location tracking technology, urban spaces and environmental elements such as gravity, water, sound and light.</span>

<span style="color: #000000;">Bech's work has been exhibited in Scandinavia, Europe, Russia and the USA, in venues including Victoria and Albert Museum (V&amp;A Sackler Centre), SIGGRAPH 2010 Art Gallery, Aarhus Kunstbygning (Centre for Contemporary Art, DK), The Fort Collins Museum of Contemporary Art (USA), L Gallery (Moscow), Trøndelag Centre of Contemporary Arts (Norway) and The Royal British Sculptors Gallery (UK)</span>

<span style="color: #000000;">She was selected for the Cultural Leadership Programme Method, Artists Leading through their practice in 2009 and her work has been featured in the Leonardo Journal, BBC News (Technology), Furtherfield, NY Arts Magazine, AN Magazine and ARCHILight. After being awarded a PhD grant (2009) Bech is carrying out doctoral research at the Digital Cultures Research Centre at UWE.</span>

<a href="http://www.tinebech.com/"><span style="color: #99cc00;">http://www.tinebech.com</span></a>
<h2><span style="color: #000000;">Clare Bowman</span></h2>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/ClareBowman1.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1690" title="" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/ClareBowman1-300x225.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="225" /></a><span style="color: #000000;">Clare Bowman hacks playful interactive installations and designs digitally fabricated consumer products. She has exhibited projects at Maker Faire UK, FutureEverything and Curiosity Collective gallery shows. Recent work includes; “Sands Everything” an interactive hourglass installation interpreting Shakespeare’s Seven Ages of Man soliloquy through gravity-controlled animated grains; Tacticalendar, a laser-cut plywood perpetual-horizon erasable calendar;  Makeastand, a creative-commons laptop stand design. Her career as a maker complements professional Occupational Therapy work, specialising everyday objects for disadvantaged clients. In her spare time, Clare is a paraglider pilot, reflexologist and coordinates a mobile massage cooperative. As a soon-to-be-mum, the nursery’s Arduinos are already on order.</span>

<a href="http://tacticalendar.co.uk/"><span style="color: #99cc00;">http://tacticalendar.co.uk</span></a>
<h2></h2>

<h2></h2>
<h2></h2>
<h2><span style="color: #000000;">Shu Lea Cheang</span></h2>
<span style="color: #000000;"><strong><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/shulea-photo1.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1489" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/shulea-photo1-300x300.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="300" /></a></strong>Cheang has engaged in large scale networked installation and performance since mid-90s.  She was the first net artist commissioned by Guggenheim Museum New York for BRANDON (1998-1999), a one year web narrative project.  She creates works, often with sci-fi scenario, that traverse between hard and soft,  sex and polities, fiction and reality,  fantasia and earth-bound, including Locker Baby Project (2001 - 2005, NTT[ICC], Tokyo, Palais de Tokyo, Paris), FLUID (2004, Detox, Norway), Agliomania (2007, PAN, Napoli), MobiOpera (2007, Sundance New Frontire), Moving Forest (2008, Transmediale, Berlin). She has co-founded and directed several  cross-platform working collectives, including TAKE2030 (london based, since 2003), Mumbai Streaming Attack (Zurich based, since 2004) and  Laptopsrus (Madrid-Paris based, since 2009).  In 2011, she launches UKI live performance, live code live spam tour while further developing UKI viral game. </span>

<a href="http://mauvaiscontact.info/"><span style="color: #99cc00;">http://mauvaiscontact.info</span></a>

<a href="http://shulea.worldofprojects.info/"><span style="color: #99cc00;">http://shulea.worldofprojects.info</span></a>
<h2><span style="color: #000000;">Alexandra Deschamps-Sonsino</span></h2>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/Alex.jpg"><span style="color: #000000;"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1329" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/Alex-300x199.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="199" /></span></a><span style="color: #000000;">Alexandra Deschamps-Sonsino was born in Montreal, Canada, but grew up in Paris and the Middle East. She returned to Canada to complete a Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Design at the Université de Montréal after which she moved to Italy to complete a Master’s degree in Interaction Design at the Interaction Design Institute Ivrea (IDII). She relocated to Amsterdam in 2006 and worked on web strategy &amp; innovation as well as user experience design work. In 2007 she moved to London and co-founded Tinker London with Massimo Banzi co-founder of the Arduino platform. She ran the studio until it closed in December 2010. She now is an evangelist for Lirec, an EU-funded project about robots, freelancing and collaborating with RIG London. She works in the Silicon Roundabout and lives in Brixton. Find her on </span><a href="http://twitter.com/#!/iotwatch"><span style="color: #000000;">twitter</span></a><span style="color: #000000;"> or see her </span><a href="http://www.linkedin.com/in/alexandradeschampssonsino"><span style="color: #000000;">linkedin profile</span></a><span style="color: #000000;">.</span>

<a href="http://designswarm.com/"><span style="color: #99cc00;">http://designswarm.com</span></a>
<h2><span style="color: #000000;">Anna Dumitriu</span></h2>
<span style="color: #000000;"><strong><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/IMG_00231.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1491" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/IMG_00231-225x300.jpg" alt="" width="225" height="300" /></a></strong></span>

<span style="color: #000000;">Anna Dumitriu’s work blurs the boundaries between art and science. Her installations, interventions and performances use a range of digital, biological and traditional media including live bacteria, interactive media and textiles. Her work has a strong international exhibition profile and is held in several major public collections, including the Science Museum in London. She was a member of the e-MobiLArt project (the EU funded European Mobile Lab for Interactive Art) and Artist in Residence at The Centre for Computational Neuroscience and Robotics at Sussex University. She is known for her work as director of  “The Institute of Unnecessary Research”, a group of artists and scientists whose work crosses disciplinary boundaries and critiques contemporary research practice. She is currently working on a Wellcome Trust funded art project entitled “Communicating Bacteria”, collaborating with the Adaptive Systems Research Group at The University of Hertfordshire (focussing on social robotics) and is Leverhulme Trust artist in residence on the Modernising Medical Microbiology project at The University of Oxford. </span>

<a href="http://www.unnecessaryresearch.org/"><span style="color: #99cc00;">http://www.unnecessaryresearch.org</span></a>

<a href="http://www.normalflora.co.uk/"><span style="color: #99cc00;">http://www.normalflora.co.uk</span></a>
<h2><span style="color: #000000;">Julie Freeman</span></h2>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/jfreeman_apr11.jpg"><span style="color: #000000;"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1330" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/jfreeman_apr11-300x300.jpg" alt="" width="248" height="248" /></span></a><span style="color: #000000;">Julie Freeman is an artist whose work spans visual, audio and digital art forms, and explores how we perceive the relationship between technology, science and nature. She is passionate about understanding the less obvious elements of our world, and about how art can incorporate science and technology to inform our perspective of these   unseen layers. Often working collaboratively, she experiments in transforming complex processes and data sets into sound compositions, objects and animations.</span>

<span style="color: #000000;">Based in the UK, Julie is a TEDGlobal 2011 fellow, a NESTA fellow, a Wellcome Trust arts awardee. She is currently artist-not-often-in-residence at Cranfield University's Microsystems and Nanotechnology Centre.</span>

<a href="http://www.translatingnature.org/"><span style="color: #99cc00;">http://www.translatingnature.org</span></a>
<h2><span style="color: #000000;">G. Hack</span></h2>
<span style="color: #000000;"><strong><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/ghack_logo1.png"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1490" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/ghack_logo1-300x157.png" alt="" width="300" height="157" /></a></strong>In February of 2011, G.Hack was formed as a response to the need for a supportive space for the women in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at Queen Mary University of London (QMUL). The aim of G.Hack is to develop a space for hands-on experience, experimental production and a women friendly learning environment. Drawing on both internal and external teaching expertise, the goal of the G.Hack is to strengthen womens' confidence and improve their abilities in the use of a range of technologies. G.Hack is a place for supporting its members research activities as well as public outreach to actively engage and support women of all ages and backgrounds interested in exploring science and technology. G.Hack is a 2011 awardee of QMUL's Small Grants for the Development of Learning and Teaching.</span>

<a href="http://ghack.eecs.qmul.ac.uk"><span style="color: #99cc00;">http://ghack.eecs.qmul.ac.uk</span></a>
<h2><span style="color: #000000;">Syuzi Pakhchyan</span></h2>
<span style="color: #000000;"><strong><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/Syuzi_headshot1.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1492" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/Syuzi_headshot1-300x244.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="244" /></a></strong></span>

<span style="color: #000000;">Syuzi Pakhchyan is fashion technologist and author with a passion for beautiful code and conductive cloth. After receiving her BFA from UC Berkeley in Literature and her MFA from the Art Center College of Design, she began a research-based design practice in 2006 focused on next generation wearable technologies. </span>

<span style="color: #000000;">Author of "Fashioning Technology" the first DIY book on interactive fashion, Syuzi has also penned numerous articles on the creative practices of interactive fashion. As a leading expert in her field, she chronicles the constantly evolving developments in wearable technology on her blog, fashioningtech.com, while continuing to develop products that are both fashionable and culturally motivated.</span>

<span style="color: #000000;">Her work has been exhibited at various conferences and events including Eyebeam, the Fashion Future Event, South by Southwest, Maker Faire and Emerging Technologies Conference.</span>

<a href="http://www.fashioningtech.com/"><span style="color: #99cc00;">http://www.fashioningtech.com</span></a>
<h2><span style="color: #000000;">Artemis Papageorgiou</span></h2>
<span style="color: #000000;"><strong></strong><span style="color: #99cc00;"><span style="color: #000000;"><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/profpicforsitesmaller.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1733" title="" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/profpicforsitesmaller-300x300.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="300" /></a>After receiving her Masters in Computational Arts at Goldsmiths College, she stayed in London where she collaborated with <span style="color: #0000ff;"><a href="http://www.cinimodstudio.com"><span style="color: #0000ff;">Cinimod Studio</span></a>, <a href="http://www.jasonbruges.com"><span style="color: #0000ff;">Jason Bruges Studio</span></a></span> and led workshops on DIY</span><span style="color: #000000;"> electronics for <span style="color: #0000ff;"><a href="http://www.mztek.org"><span style="color: #0000ff;">MzTEK</span></a></span> collective. Upon arrival in Athens she begun her collaboration with <span style="color: #0000ff;"><a href="http://www.afu.gr"><span style="color: #0000ff;">AFU </span></a></span>where she currently designs industrial parametric furniture and helps market the brand. In her free time she designs games and runs workshops for grown-ups</span><span style="color: #000000;"> and children. Her work has been exhibited in shows such as the Locus Solus (Benaki Museum, Athens 2010), Passing Through, (James Taylor Gallery 2009), <span style="color: #0000ff;"><a href="http://www.kinetica-artfair.com"><span style="color: #0000ff;">Kinetica Art Fair</span></a></span> (P3 Exhibition Space 2009), Double Take (Eyebeam New York 2008). She is also a co-founder of <span style="color: #0000ff;"><a href="http://athensplaython.org"><span style="color: #0000ff;">Athens Plaython</span></a></span> a marathon of big games and workshops launching in 2012 in Athens, Greece.</span></span></span>

<span style="color: #99cc00;"><a href="http://www.cinimodstudio.com/"><span style="color: #99cc00;">http://artemispapageorgiou.com</span></a></span>

<span style="color: #99cc00;"><a href="http://www.athensplaython.org/" target="_blank"><span style="color: #99cc00;">http://www.athensplaython.org</span></a></span>
<h2><span style="color: #000000;">Mika Satomi</span></h2>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/4799103722_a07a3638fe_o.jpg"><span style="color: #000000;"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1332" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/4799103722_a07a3638fe_o-199x300.jpg" alt="" width="199" height="300" /></span></a><span style="color: #000000;">Mika Satomi is currently a researcher at The Smart Textile Design Lab at Textilehögskolan in Borås, Sweden. Only satisfied when things are working, Mika Satomi is always looking for new ways to use any kind of material, or bending existing techniques to her needs. She likes to find solutions for technical and artistic problems and to share this knowledge and experiences with others. As an artist Mika poses questions which are provoking peoples thoughts, opening their minds or twisting common views.  Since 2006 Mika has collaborated with Hannah Perner-Wilson, forming the collective KOBAKANT. She holds BA in graphic design from Tokyo Zokei University, and MA in media creation from IAMAS, Japan.</span>

<a href="http://www.nerding.at/"><span style="color: #99cc00;">http://www.nerding.at</span></a>

<span style="color: #99cc00;"><a href="http://www.kobakant.at/"><span style="color: #99cc00;">http://www.kobakant.at</span></a></span>
<h2><span style="color: #000000;">Eunjoo Shin</span></h2>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/portrait.jpg"><span style="color: #000000;"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1333" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/portrait-269x300.jpg" alt="" width="269" height="300" /></span></a><span style="color: #000000;">Eunjoo Shin, an artist, explores interaction design, sound and public installation. Her art works have been featured in many venues, including FILE festival 2009 in Sao Paulo, Redhead gallery at Lower Manhattan Cultural Council (LMCC) in New York and Seoul Art Center in Seoul. Her work, Vocal Trio was selected as one of the best interaction designs by the Korean Federation of Design Associations, and published in the design yearbook, CREATIO 2009.</span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="color: #99cc00;"><a href="http://comms.me/">
</a></span><span style="color: #99cc00;"><a href="http://comms.me/"><span style="color: #99cc00;">http://www.ejoo.org</span></a></span></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="color: #99cc00;"><a href="http://comms.me/"><span style="color: #99cc00;">http://comms.me</span></a></span><span style="color: #99cc00;"><a href="http://comms.me/">
</a></span></span>

		<title>Support</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/programs/chi-tek/support/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 15 Aug 2011 14:01:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?page_id=1459</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We would like say say a GREAT BIG thank you to all those generous people who have contributed to Chi-TEK so far, and who believe in what we do.

Many thanks to all those people who have contributed to helping us deliver Chi-TEK and all it encompasses; workshops, brand new art work from amazingly talented and creative women and the Chi-TEK Tea Party!

In no particular order, THANK YOU!

Bethan McDonald
Sally Caulwell
Paul McBride
Lucy Bannister
Julie Freeman
Varvara Guljajeva
Molly Kleiman
Helen Northmore
James Carrigan
Stephen Mccarthy
Mika Forsberg
Davide Della Casa
oomlout .:.
Janet Giles
E R Jones
Alexandra McDonald
Brian Nolan
Alan Waldock
A Rodnes
Anna Dumitriu
Kate Jessop
Sally Caulwell
Anne Donlon
Keith Simpson
George Profenza
James Carrigan
Iain Sharp

We hope to see you at the Chi-TEK Tea Party!
<h2>As well as all these lovely people's individual contributions, we have had kind support from...</h2>
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Adafruit-smallGrey1.png"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1592 alignnone" title="Adafruit-smallGrey" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Adafruit-smallGrey1-300x120.png" alt="" width="300" height="120" /></a> <a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Sugrulogo.gif"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1593" title="Sugrulogo" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Sugrulogo-300x46.gif" alt="" width="300" height="46" /></a> <a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/LOGO-shaded-300.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1803" title="LOGO-shaded-300" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/LOGO-shaded-300.png" alt="" width="240" height="50" /></a> <a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/teapigs_RGBsmall.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1589 alignleft" title="teapigs_RGBsmall" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/teapigs_RGBsmall-300x67.jpg" alt="" width="210" height="47" /></a></p>]]></content:encoded>

		<pubDate>Wed, 31 Aug 2011 07:08:52 +0000</pubDate>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Interactive - Modified - Hacked teapots by leading women artists and designers at the Victoria &amp; Albert Museum’s Sackler Centre
<h2>The Chi-TEK Tea Party</h2>
<strong>Saturday 24 &amp; Sunday 25 September 2011</strong>
Join us for tea, cake and an electric showcase of interactive teapots, modified / hacked by a brilliant range of women makers and designers.
<h2>The Chi-TEK Showcase</h2>
<strong>September 2011 —</strong>
The specially commissioned works will be on display in the Victoria &amp; Albert Museum’s Sackler Centre
<h2>Workshops</h2>
Information on how to book your place on the Chi-TEK workshops will soon be available on our web site and through our mailing list, <a title="MzMail" href="http://mztek.org/mailman/listinfo/allsubscribers_mztek.org" target="_blank">MzMail</a>. Please be aware booking is essential and workshops are open to only women registrants.

<strong>T-Hack with G.HACK</strong>
<strong>19 November 2011 - [space] studios</strong>
A creative technology workshop for women
Tech up your tea with contributing Chi-TEK artists G.HACK
Part of the Chi-TEK project by MzTEK
<a href="http://ghack.eecs.qmul.ac.uk/">http://ghack.eecs.qmul.ac.uk/</a>

<strong>Chi-FEST Creative Technology</strong>
<strong>22 October - Limehouse Town Hall</strong>
4 workshops by 4 Chi-TEK artists
Spend the day dipping in to the different courses
Each workshop lasts 1 hour 30mins and you can attend 3 throughout the day
<em> Booking essential</em>, more details soon.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>MzTEK is on her way...</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2009/01/mztek-is-on-her-way/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 24 Jan 2009 16:40:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=21</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>MzTEK is an artist-led collective for women involved in media art. We're putting together a 3-month programme of workshops across topics like physical computing, cctv hacking, pervasive media, web fu and so on, and are looking for interested people to teach, who want to learn, or (hopefully) both. If this sounds interesting, get in touch.</p>
<p>We'll also be organising MzTEK Meet, a fortnightly gathering for techies and artists. There'll be a short talk on something tech and art flavoured, and lots of time for chatting and beer. The idea is to learn something, meet people and enjoy. Watch this space for upcoming events and <a title="facebook group" href="http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=46702402694" target="_blank">join our Facebook group</a>.</p>]]></content:encoded>

So... we have decided is to start the <strong>Peer2Peer</strong> sessions as soon as possible, and to work out who has what skills and who wants what skills. This will be set up on a wiki soon, for you to add your skills and requests to.

Our first P2P session will be an introduction to web design and WordPress by Sally on the 15th February... Venue TBC.

We will also be starting the <strong>MzTEK Unplugged</strong> meets as soon as possible, and will keep you posted with details of this.

Thanks for your help and feedback on the <strong>MzTEK Course</strong> too. As we discussed, we need your help and input in to which courses you would like to attend on the tutored part of the course. Please add your course suggestions to the <strong>MzTEK wiki </strong>"here".  We will keep this open to suggestions until the 15th Feb. 	<item>
		<title>W00t M33t</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2009/02/w00t-m33t/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 06 Feb 2009 23:30:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=86</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Have a project you need some help on?  Come out to <a href="http://www.arthouseparty.net/?p=324">W00t M33t tonight</a>:

"Sing hosannas, the w00t is back!
Once upon a time, there was a monthly gathering of art party organisers, mischief makers, mad inventors, geeks and dilettantes. They met for plotting and beer drinking purposes, and evil schemes were hatched. Then life intervened, and there were no w00ts for a while.But then people kept asking me: ‘Where is the w00t?’. So by popular demand, it’s back. It’s moved from the Dog Star, as it wasn’t really fair on anyone who doesn’t live in South London. Instead, we’ve booked some space upstairs at The Plough pub in Bloomsbury on Thursday 5 Feb. And we are going to w00t in it.

Where: http://www.fancyapint.com/pubs/pub355.html
When: thursday 5 Feb, from 8pm
What: beer, plotting and more beer and more plotting. (There’s food, too, though no nachos sadly).

Hope to see you there! "

]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Customize A WordPress Theme</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2009/02/customize-a-wordpress-theme/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 06 Feb 2009 23:49:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=90</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Welcome to our first P2P Session!  Ever wondered how to customize CSS, HTML, and PHP templates?  Come to our first Peer2Peer workshop to find out.

<strong>Who:</strong> This workshop is best suited for those with a WordPress Web site (or blog) already established and would like to learn how to customize a theme—the design.

<strong>Where:</strong> <a href="http://www.foundry.tv/index.html">The Foundry</a>, downstairs

<strong>What You'll Learn:</strong> We'll be covering some of the basics of interaction design (user flows, personas, and feature development), Web development (HTML, PHP templates), and Web design (CSS, Flash text)

<strong>What You'll Need:</strong> What you'll need before/for class:

* Your laptop (wifi enabled)

* Dreamweaver — you can download the latest CS4 trial version at
adobe.com. Another html editor is fine, but it'd be easier if we're all on
the same page, so to speak, and using WYSIWYG software

* A Web site — that's a domain AND host. If you don't have this set up
yet, or access to one to practice on, you can easily subscribe for one at
bluehost.com or yahoo.com to name a few... otherwise ask a friend!

* WordPress — Please download and install WordPress on your site if you
don't already have it. If you don't,, it's easy (and free):
www.wordpress.org.

Pluses, but not necessary:

* Flash — you can download this from adobe.com
* siFR 3 — download the package here:
http://dev.novemberborn.net/sifr3/nightlies/sifr3-r436.zip
* Fireworks — you can download this from adobe.com

<strong>How: </strong>RSVP by <a href="mailto:info@mztek.org">email</a>.  Please include your name &amp; which date is best for you of the above options. Majority vote rules, however if the demand remains, we could host another in the near future.]]></content:encoded>

		<title>WordPress P2P Success!</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2009/02/wordpress-p2p-success/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 24 Feb 2009 14:38:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Last Friday a bunch of us successfully geeked out at The Foundry, covering some WordPress basics such as organization (post vs page, category vs tag) . Then we delved into some basic theme customization: PHP WordPress Template Tags, stylesheets, and troubleshooting.

With the odd beer break, it was a fun sesh and <a href="http://sebastianmary.com/wordpress/">some</a> of us have since been updating our WordPress blogs...

Here's some pics below!  And a <a title="p2p_powerpoint" href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/02/p2p_wordpress_theme_customization.pdf" target="_blank">link to the nerdy powerpoint</a> I put together.
