	<item>
		<title>MzTEK @ /ETC - wearble tech workshop</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2009/06/mztek-etc-wearble-tech-workshop/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 11 Jun 2009 09:30:51 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=424</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This year there are two Eclectic Tech Carnival's, and I'm at the one going on in HUMLab, in Umea, very far north of Sweden with 24hr day light!!!

it all strated with a group called <a href="http://www.genderchangers.org">Gender Changers</a>.  If you wondering what a gender changer is, its one of these...

<img class="size-full wp-image-437 alignnone" title="mini-gender-changer-11400097-s" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/mini-gender-changer-11400097-s.jpg" alt="mini-gender-changer-11400097-s" width="120" height="120" />

So, Eclectic Tech Carnival has been on for three days now. I have been to heaps of workshops, from animating dolls with motors to wearable technology, Open Source discussions to making microphones for musical instruments that use human hair as strings!!!!!  (actually sounds better than wire or nylon)
<p style="text-align: center;">Here are some pics from workshops so far...
<img class="size-medium wp-image-425 aligncenter" title="wearables_workshop" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/wearables_workshop-300x201.jpg" alt="wearables_workshop" width="300" height="201" />

This was the wearable tech workshop i went to. Kyveli gave a really nice intro some cool tricks to making cheap and discrete power supplies to all your fancy wearable tech needs.  Check this out...
<p style="text-align: center;"><img class="size-full wp-image-426 aligncenter" title="key_batterypack" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/key_batterypack.jpg" alt="key_batterypack" width="593" height="138" /></p>
<p style="text-align: center;">I made a cool bracelet that used surface mount LED's soldered to metal beads, one side sewn to a conductive material and the other left loose to make a connection as you move around, so it kind of sparkled...</p>

<p style="text-align: center;"><img class="size-full wp-image-428 aligncenter" title="soldering-smled" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/soldering-smled.jpg" alt="soldering-smled" width="210" height="174" />
<img class="size-full wp-image-430 aligncenter" title="wearable_bracelette" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/wearable_bracelette.jpg" alt="wearable_bracelet" width="280" height="188" />

The fabric was already conductive, and the weave being in one direction meant i could make a circuit from it.  I just had to sew some more conductive thread from the battery to the fabric, and then across a bit from the positive and negative points (making sure they didn't cross over) to make the circuit the right width for the LED's. The LED's then acted like an on off switch when they made contact with the opposite part of the circuit running down the weave of the fabric... if that makes sense?

OK... more to come very soon...]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>MzTEK @ /ETC - Music &amp; hair...</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2009/06/mztek-etc-music-hair/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 11 Jun 2009 10:20:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=443</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Yes! We made music with our beautiful locks!

First we made the mic by wiring up a mono jack to a piezo,
<p style="text-align: center;"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-445" title="piezo" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/piezo.jpg" alt="piezo" width="200" height="150" /></p>

then we gaffered (naturally) the piezo to a tin can.
<p style="text-align: center;"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-446" title="tincan" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/tincan.jpg" alt="tincan" width="240" height="180" /></p>

Then we pulled out our own hair, suffering for our art, and fixed it across the tin can. Then we plugged them into an eff off great amp and blew the roof off of HUMLab! Actually it sounded quite sweets at times and we managed to get a harmony (of sorts) coming from the speakers, but that might have just been feedback.

That workshop was run by a cool artists from Dublin, <a href="http://mavr.netfirms.com/joanhealy/index.html">Joan Healy</a>. As it happens she will be performing at Shunt in London 23rd - 27th June and she said she'd be well up for doing a workshop for MzTEK while she's in town.  SWEET!!!!  I'll sort that out when i get back, but email info@mztek.org if your interested.

L8as!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Tinkerbelles &amp; Arduinorama Mammas</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2009/06/tinkerbelles-arduinorama-mamma/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 22 Jun 2009 19:36:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=459</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[So, we had a blast last Saturday tinkering on Arduinos for the first time (well, for most of us), at [ SPACE ].

Artemis led us through a great 3 hour P2P sesh on Arduinos and sensors. We learned:

- how to make a circuit using the Arduino, a breadboard, and some wires
- how to make a little LED light blink using the above, plus a wee bit of easy programming
- using buttons to open and close circuits
- using potentiometers (mouthful there) to dim/brighten LEDs.

It was awesome, and I'm really looking forward to our upcoming workshops now.  I'll post some pics below.

Getting an LED to light up with a button

<img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-467" title="arduino-with-button" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/p1010778-300x225.jpg" alt="arduino-with-button" width="300" height="225" />

Artemis helping us along

<img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-466" title="gathered around artemis" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/p1010767-300x225.jpg" alt="gathered around artemis" width="300" height="225" />

She's a PC too...

<img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-465" title="caroline helping" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/p1010770-300x225.jpg" alt="caroline helping" width="300" height="225" />

Now let's try the blue one!

<img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-464" title="arduino and led light" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/p1010765-300x225.jpg" alt="arduino and led light" width="300" height="225" />

A toolbox for tinkering.

<img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-461" title="the toolbox" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/p1010768-300x225.jpg" alt="the toolbox" width="300" height="225" />

Sonia and Sophie, showing off their work. It works! It really works!

<img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-460" title="sonia and sophie" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/p1010775-300x225.jpg" alt="sonia and sophie" width="300" height="225" />

And in case you lost your notes, ladies, I have Artemis's sketches too.  For whatever reason, WordPress has rotated them, so just turn your head 90 degrees counter-clockwise.

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/p10107821.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-470" title="p10107821" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/p10107821-300x225.jpg" alt="p10107821" width="300" height="225" /></a>

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/p1010781.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-463" title="p1010781" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/p1010781-300x225.jpg" alt="p1010781" width="300" height="225" /></a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Hair raising harmonies!</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2009/06/p2p-workshop-musicalhair/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 24 Jun 2009 09:53:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=473</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[THIS SUNDAY 28th JUNE, 12 noon - 2pm - Pizza and hair of the dog at Sal's place.

Following from her excellent 'make music with your hair' workshop at Eclectic Tech Carnival (/ETC) in Umea, Sweden, Joan is up for doing it again for MzTEK.  Check out the<a href="http://www.mztek.org/mztek-etc-music-hair"> blog post</a> I wrote on the workshop at /ETC for an idea of what it in-tales (ha ha!)

RSVP to info@mztek.org for workshop location, Shoreditch area.

<img class="aligncenter size-medium wp-image-553" title="hairybanjo1" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/hairybanjo1-225x300.jpg" alt="hairybanjo1" width="225" height="300" />
<p style="text-align: center;">&nbsp;</p>
<a href="http://mavr.netfirms.com/joanhealy/index.html" target="_blank">Joan Healy</a> is in town to perform <a href="http://www.shunt.co.uk/events.php" target="_blank"><strong><em>Becoming a Franz West</em></strong></a> TONIGHT (wed 24th) at <a href="http://www.shunt.co.uk/" target="_blank">Shunt </a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Following from her excellent 'make music with your hair' workshop at Eclectic Tech Carnival (/ETC) in Umea, Sweden, artist Joan Healy teaches us how to make music with a strand of hair, a piezo, and electricity.]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Sinful Machines</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2009/06/sinful-machines/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 30 Jun 2009 16:20:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=479</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Here you go, a fantastic workshop led by the creative gals at <a href="http://www.seaweedstudio.co.uk/" target="_blank">Seaweed Studios</a>, in the tricked out front media studio at <a href="http://www.spacestudios.org.uk/" target="_blank">[ SPACE ]</a>.

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/sinful-machines-flyer-correct.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-480" title="sinful-machines-flyer-correct" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/sinful-machines-flyer-correct.jpg" alt="sinful-machines-flyer-correct" width="499" height="672" /></a>

<a href="mailto:info@mztek.org">RSVP soon</a>—Get it while it's hot!  Space for 15 participants and a 20% reduction fee for tickets purchased before July 12.

Bring your own <a href="http://www.arduino.cc/">Arduino</a>, or borrow one from us.  Let us know if you need one, however. You may also purchase a beginner kit at <a href="http://oomlout.com" target="_blank">oomlout.com</a>.

<strong>|| ABOUT THE WORKSHOP ||</strong>

<strong>MzTEK presents: Sinful Machines with <a href="http://www.seaweedstudio.co.uk/" target="_blank">Seaweed Studio</a></strong>
July 25 &amp; 2006, 11am - 5pm
at [ SPACE ] 129-131 Mare Street, Hackney, London E8 3RH

Sinful machines is a workshop which is part of a project exploring the delicate relationship between man, machines and sins. How is a sin defined? In the original sense of the word, to sin means to 'err' or miss the mark, but modern definitions associate it with violations of a morality.  What happens when 7 deadly sins and social sins manifest themselves within machines?

Throughout the weekend, we will take you through the design and creation of your own interactive 'sinful machine' using Arduino and components such as sensors, lights, motors, mp3 players and more.

Perfect for complete beginners and those with intermediate knowledge Arduino skills, we welcome people of all age and gender. For those who are stuck for ideas, we will also prepare a few examples to show on the day to inspire and help you through your project concept.

If you have any concerns about your ability to attend as you have children and need someone to mind them, don't hesitate to speak to us about having a creche in [SPACE]'s courtyard.

<strong>RSVP to <a href="mailto:info@mztek.org" target="_blank">info@mztek.org</a></strong>

£65, includes lunch both days.  £45 special if you register before July 12.
Bring your own Arduino or borrow one from us
Supported by<a href="http://www.spacestudios.org.uk/"> [ SPACE ]
</a><a href="http://www.seaweedstudio.co.uk/" target="_blank"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-488" title="darkbglogo" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/darkbglogo.gif" alt="darkbglogo" width="168" height="103" /></a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Throughout the weekend, we will take you through the design and creation of your own interactive ‘sinful machine’ using Arduino and components such as sensors, lights, motors, mp3 players and more.]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:post_date_gmt>2009-06-30 16:20:20</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>

	<item>
		<title>SolarBots</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2009/09/solarbots/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 01 Sep 2009 09:53:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=512</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-535" title="solarbots_post_flyer" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/07/solarbots_post_flyer.jpg" alt="solarbots_post_flyer" width="533" height="373" />
<h3>Thank everyone who made SOLARBOTS such a fun day!</h3>
Check out the pics from the SOLARBOTS workshop <a href="http://www.mztek.org/solarbot-pics/">here!</a>
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="www.mztek.org/solarbot-pics/"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-566" title="bugeyes" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/09/bugeyes.jpg" alt="bugeyes" width="230" height="207" /></a></p>

<h3>make your own solar powered robot bugs!</h3>
12th September,  11am - 5pm,
at SPACE, 129-131 Mare Street,  London E8 3RH.
£15

Calling all beginner tinkerers - come and learn how to make your own solar powered robot bug from scratch.  All components are provided for you to complete your very own solarbot bug to take home with you at the end of the day.  All you need is fabric, feathers and stick on eyes or anything else you need to pimp up your bot!  The workshop is aimed at beginners, but all are welcome for a fun day out.

The workshop will be lead by artist Varvara Guljajeva, originally from Estonia, she is currently living and working in Linz, Austria.  <a href="http://varvarag.cdrews.de/">http://varvarag.cdrews.de/</a>
<h3><a href="http://mztek.eventwax.com/solarbot-bugs/register">SIGN UP HERE NOW!</a></h3>
Priority booking will go to women/girl participants, <strong>bookings will be open to all on 27th August.</strong>

Please get in touch if you require any creche facilities.

For more info email us at <a href="mailto:info@mztek.org" target="_blank">info@mztek.org</a>

Supported by  SPACE,  129-131 Mare Street, Hackney, London E8 3RH
And with the generous support of Fritz at <a href="http://www.pagermotors.com">PagerMotors.com</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>TALK:  MzTEK &amp; The Power of 8</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2009/09/mztek-and-the-power-of-8/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 12 Sep 2009 16:06:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=544</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img class="aligncenter size-medium wp-image-556" title="picture-4" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/09/picture-4-300x49.png" alt="picture-4" width="300" height="49" />

MzTEK is going to Watermans for the day to see the Power of 8 exhibition, and to talk with Anab Jain, the designer and filmmaker who conceived of, and initiated the project.

We welcome any women interested to come and join us for the morning at Watermans, and then we'll go for a pub lunch after to chew the fat/cud, and generally have a nice afternoon.

The power of 8 is collaborative project, 8 people from different walks of life work together to build a public conversation about their individual aspirations for a desirable future.

For the past few years, Anab has worked on speculative projects around emerging technologies, to encourage debate on the different possible futures that may happen. As a designer, this genre of design fiction aims to impact our current day concepts by enabling us to think of directions in which our collective future is shaped

Check out <a href="http://powerof8.org.uk">powerof8.org.uk</a> for more details on the project.

Please RSVP by signing up here...
<a href="http://mztek.eventwax.com/power-of-8--watermans" target="_blank">http://mztek.eventwax.com/power-of-8--watermans</a>

Let us know if you fancy joining us and we can arrange meeting there or at Waterloo, info@mztek.org

When/where etc...

27th September, 11.30am onwards...

Watermans
40 High Street
Brentford TW8 0DS

<a href="http://www.watermans.org.uk/">watermans.org.uk</a>

How to get here
Bus 65, 237, 267, and N9 all stop outside Watermans
Tube: South Ealing (Piccadilly) and Gunnersbury (District) at about 1 mile
Train: Kew Bridge &amp; Brentfort (trains from Waterloo and Hounslow) are a 10 minute walk]]></content:encoded>

<h3>Thanks everyone who made SOLARBOTS such a fun day!</h3>

	<item>
		<title>SHOW &amp; TELL:  Julie Freeman</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2009/11/julie-freeman-show-n-tell-3rd-dec/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 10 Nov 2009 10:37:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=629</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h3>Calling all women artists/techies/tinkerers!</h3>
Come and join Julie Freeman introducing the technicalities of her latest work in the next MzTEK P2P show 'n' tell.

Julie recently returned from ISEA (International Symposium of Electronic Arts) in Belfast at the end of August, where she showed the piece Specious Dialogue III.

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/11/sd_i_lon_03-300x224.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-631" title="sd_i_lon_03-300x224" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/11/sd_i_lon_03-300x224.jpg" alt="sd_i_lon_03-300x224" width="300" height="224" /></a>
Specious Dialogue III consists of a pair of movable, sculptural concrete forms that house wireless audio playback systems. Mounted on pairs of swivel castors the forms are designed to be played with – pushed, rolled, kicked and shoved around the exhibition space. They are physical audio curiosities with personality.
Julie will be discussing the story of the work from the initial commission through to version 3.  She will talk about how she built it from sourcing and constructing the concrete forms, to the writing of the Max&gt;/MSP patch as well as the development of the piece through the sound recording and editing. She will be accompanied by sound producer Dan Grigson (Grantby) who will give hands-on hints and tips on voice-over recording, editing and formating.

<a href="http://www.translatingnature.org/2009/specious-dialogue-iii/" target="_blank">http://www.translatingnature.org/2009/specious-dialogue-iii/</a>

Specious Dialogue was commissioned by Cybersonica for Soundwaves 07 and has been shown in London, Luxembourg, Dublin and Limerick.

December 3rd, 6pm - 8pm
Space,  129 - 131 Mare St, Hackney, London, E8 3RH
How to get there... <a href="http://www.spacestudios.org.uk/contact/SPACE/" target="_blank">http://www.spacestudios.org.uk/contact/SPACE/</a>
Please feel free to bring refreshments]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Electronics for Absolute Beginners</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2009/12/workshop-basic-electronics/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 06 Dec 2009 11:03:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=639</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Everything you ever wanted to know to build a circuit from scratch, but were afraid to ask!
January 23rd, 11am - 5pm
SPACE, 129 - 131 Mare Street Hackney London, E8 3RH.

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/12/picture-4.png"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-641" title="picture-4" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/12/picture-4.png" alt="picture-4" width="477" height="358" /></a>
Tutor <a href="http://www.lushprojects.com" target="_blank">Iain Sharp</a>, a lecky pro, will guide you through the basics of how to get electricity to do what you want using a basic circuit that includes some pencil draw components.

The day will focus on how electronics work and will include experiments that demonstrate what different components do. We will use a breadboard to build the circuit, so a lot less soldering than in previous workshops!

Take a look at Iain's demo video here:<a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=igXh4fMqVCA" target="_blank"> http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=igXh4fMqVCA</a>
<h3>Priority booking for women/girl participants open now. Registration open to all on 13th Jan 2010.</h3>
<h2>SOLD OUT!</h2>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Arduino Basics</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2010/02/next-workshop-arduino-basics-1/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 10 Feb 2010 15:11:13 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=705</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/arduino_workshop.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-710" title="arduino_workshop" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/arduino_workshop.jpg" alt="arduino_workshop" width="500" height="450" /></a>

Supported by <a href="http://spacestudios.org.uk">SPACE</a>.

Coming up in a few week's time : our next exciting workshop.  This time, interactive expert <a title="plankman.com" href="http://www.plankman.com/" target="_blank">Daniel Hirschmann</a> takes us through an introduction to Arduino and how to get started programming and setting up basic interactive elements.  We'll cover the basic circuitry, programming Arduino, and users various sensors and components.

The kick-off to a series of Arduino-based workshops, this first one will get you situated using fun sensors, lights, and components.

Sign up quickly as spaces are limited!  <a href="http://mztek.eventwax.com/arduino-basics-workshop-1">Sign up for the event now!</a>

Arduino starter kits are available at Oomlout.com.  <a href="http://oomlout.co.uk/arduino-starter-kit-ardx-p-183.html" target="_blank">Pre-order your kit today</a>, if you would like to be able to work with your own Arduino and take your project home with you.  Extra kit will be available at the workshop to borrow (and possibly purchase) for the course, if you don't bring your own.

Please <a title="email us" href="mailto:info@mztek.org">contact us</a> if you have any questions

<a href="http://mztek.eventwax.com/arduino-basics-workshop-1">
</a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Interactive expert Daniel Hirschmann takes us through an introduction to Arduino and how to get started programming and setting up basic interactive elements.  We'll cover the basic circuitry, programming Arduino, and users various sensors and components.]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<title>MzTEKumentary</title>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Hi Friends,

We're conducting a survey to strengthen our programs and research what you want, what your experience with us has been, and what you want to learn!

Take a moment (weeeee moment) and <a href="http://spreadsheets.google.com/a/mztek.org/viewform?hl=en&formkey=dDdTWGFHZ1pWckdHb0pZc2NwbXJlaGc6MA">fill out our survey</a> to help us in our quest for awesomeness.

Love, MzTEK

	<item>
		<title>Arduino Basics Roundup</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2010/03/arduino-basics-roundup/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 01 Mar 2010 17:20:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=743</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/p1020374.jpg"><img class="alignright size-thumbnail wp-image-736" title="p1020374" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/p1020374-150x150.jpg" alt="p1020374" width="150" height="150" /></a>

What a long, fun day! We started with interactive designer and tutor Daniel Hirschmann by exploring electricity, the basics of circuit building (and those of use who attended Iain's awesome Basic Electronics workshop were in the know).

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/p1020360.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-741" title="p1020360" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/p1020360-300x225.jpg" alt="p1020360" width="243" height="182" /></a>

Then we moved onto some programming in Arduino and getting the board to respond to stimuli and output feedback in our serial port.

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/p1020360.jpg">
</a>

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/p1020379.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-735 alignright" title="p1020379" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/p1020379-300x225.jpg" alt="p1020379" width="205" height="154" /></a>

Finally, we put it all together, building circuits, working with analog and digital writes and reads, playing with force resistors, light sensors, buttons, etc.

For anyone who is not familiar with all of the above, any step can be a big hurdle (let alone combining programming &amp; circuitry in one go.)

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/p1020386.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-737 alignleft" title="p1020386" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/p1020386-300x225.jpg" alt="p1020386" width="212" height="159" /></a>

If you attended the workshop and would like to review or revisit anything we did, Daniel will be posting notes to the workshop on his site, or you can <a href="mailto:info@mztek.org">email us</a> for circuit images (close ups!) and code.

Special thanks to <a href="http://www.spacestudios.org.uk/" target="_blank">SPACE</a> for their support and donating their fantastic front media lab.

XO, MzTEK]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>MzTEK Library Entry No 1</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2010/03/mztek-library-entry-no-1/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 10 Mar 2010 14:17:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=749</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Last night we went over to <a href="http://resonancefm.com/" target="_blank">ResonanceFM</a> (104.1) to talk a little about MzTEK with <a href="http://www.furtherfield.org/" target="_blank">Furtherfield</a>'s Marc Garrett.  What a fun program, jitters aside!  If you didn't listen last night, stay tuned as a podcast will be available soon (we'll link to it here of course.)

A<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/detail_99691.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-750" title="digital_pioneers" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/detail_99691-300x300.jpg" alt="digital_pioneers" width="300" height="300" /></a>lso speaking was curator Douglas Dodd from the V&amp;A, who discussed the <a href="http://www.vam.ac.uk/exhibitions/future_exhibs/Digital%20Pioneers/index.html" target="_blank"> Digital Pioneers exhibition</a> and some quite interesting facts about the history of making art with computers (think long before Photoshop, Kraftwerk, etc.)

And lucky for us, we were able to snag a nifty copy of the beautiful exhibition book—a first entry in the MzTEK library (and god willing not the last!)

Thanks Mr. Dodd and the folks at Furtherfield!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>GggggeekOUT!</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2010/08/gggggeekout/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 10 Aug 2010 12:25:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=753</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h1>Summer geekOut!</h1>


August 21st, 1.30pm - 6.30pm at Watermans Gallery.

To start our season of workshops and events, we invite all women artists, techies and tinkerers to come and geekOut.

Bring your projects, ideas, or come and practice projects from our previous workshops. We will have computers, projector, previous workshop pdf’s, and some tools and components available to borrow, but if you have something in mind to work on, please bring tools and components you know you will need, if you can.

This will not be a tutored event, but an opportunity to play, learn and practice anything that takes your fancy, and to catch up on the SolarBots, Electronics for Absolute Beginners and Arduinorama workshops.

If you have any kit from previous workshops, bring it along!

When?
21st August '10 – 1.30pm – 6.30pm

Where?
Watermans Gallery - 40 High Street Brentford TW8 0DS

£5
SIGN UP HERE: http://mztek.eventwax.com/mztek-summer-geek-out
Book your place now!

If you have any queries, please contact us on sophie [dot] mcdonald @ gmail [dot] com]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>SketchTag: programming made fun!</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2010/09/sketchtag-programming-made-fun/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 10 Sep 2010 16:07:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=771</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/picture-14.png"><img class="alignleft size-thumbnail wp-image-775" title="picture-14" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/picture-14-150x150.png" alt="picture-14" width="150" height="150" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/picture-76.png"><img class="alignleft size-thumbnail wp-image-774" title="picture-76" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/picture-76-150x150.png" alt="picture-76" width="150" height="150" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/screen-shot-2010-08-07-at-173844.png"><img class="alignleft size-thumbnail wp-image-773" title="screen-shot-2010-08-07-at-173844" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/screen-shot-2010-08-07-at-173844-150x150.png" alt="screen-shot-2010-08-07-at-173844" width="150" height="150" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/picture-30.png"><img class="alignleft size-thumbnail wp-image-778" title="picture-30" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/picture-30-150x150.png" alt="picture-30" width="150" height="150" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/picture-24.png"><img class="alignleft size-thumbnail wp-image-780" title="picture-24" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/picture-24-150x150.png" alt="picture-24" width="150" height="150" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/picture-18.png"><img class="alignleft size-thumbnail wp-image-779" title="picture-18" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/picture-18-150x150.png" alt="picture-18" width="150" height="150" /></a>
<h3>Another opportunity for all you geek girls to get nerdy...
Come and collaborate on animations and interactive drawings, created by you from the code up!</h3>
This is a fun and easy way for everyone to share programs, for newbies and experts alike.

<a href="http://www.sketchpatch.net">sketchPatch</a> is an online programming playground, using the programming language <a href="http://processing.org">Processing</a>. The workshop is a game of tag, in which everyone contributes to each others sketch as they are passed around the group. It will be an opportunity for complete novices to get tinkering with some code, and experts to collaborate, and pass on skills.

At the end of the day we will print sketches out and turn them into BADGES!

So come and join sketchPatch.net in a round of sketchTag!

sketchPatch is featured in the '<a href="http://www.watermans.org.uk/exhibitions/unleashed_devices/">Unleashed Devices</a>' exhibition at Waterman's Art Gallery, and will be taking part in London Digital Design week at the V&amp;A 25th &amp; 26th September… so make a sketch and you can get your work in there too!

sketchPatch fun &amp; games
at <a href="http://www.spacestudios.org.uk/">SPACE</a>, Hackney, London
Oct 2nd 2010
12pm - 4pm
£10

<a href="http://mztek.eventwax.com/sketchtag-fun-n-games">SIGN UP HERE...</a>

Play with me...
&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Your browser does not support iframes.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;

&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Your browser does not support iframes.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[sketchPatch is an online programming playground, using the programming language Processing. The workshop is a game of tag, in which everyone contributes to each others sketch as they are passed around the group. It will be an opportunity for complete novices to get tinkering with some code, and experts to collaborate, and pass on skills.]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Autumn geekOut!!!</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2010/10/autumn-geekout/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 03 Oct 2010 15:12:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=841</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[October 9th, 1.30pm - 6.30pm at Watermans Gallery.

	<item>
		<title>Cutting It Up... Laser Style!</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2010/10/cutting-it-up-laser-style/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 14 Oct 2010 15:08:07 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=862</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h3>A workshop in cutting stuff up with a laser!</h3>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/10/laser_kitties.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-medium wp-image-863" title="laser_kitties" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/10/laser_kitties-300x256.jpg" alt="laser_kitties" width="300" height="256" /></a>

Not kitties though!
<h3>Get your designs off the page and cut them out of acrylic, wood, vinyl, paper, card or fabric… using the power of light!</h3>
If the thought of laser-cutting, CNC machine, circuit design and prototyping fills you with excitement and/or confusion, we have the perfect antidote for you!

Maybe you have seen cute acrylic jewellery, or delectable vinyl decals, or you have a world-changing invention that you have to figure out how to make the cogs and parts… then this is the place for you!

The workshop will consist of an intro to image formatting of designs, and laser cutting.

Please feel free to bring with you some designs or pictures on paper or USB, as well as any materials to experiment with, but no more than 6mm thick and 24” x 18” wide (to fit the machine).
<h2>When?</h2>
October 30th – 11am – 5pm
<h2>Where?</h2>
SMARTLAB, Knowledge Dock, Uni East London, Docklands Campus.
Nearest station is Cyprus on the DLR
<a href="http://maps.google.co.uk/maps?client=firefox-%20a&amp;hl=en&amp;ie=UTF8&amp;ll=51.507447,0.064341&amp;spn=0.003212,0.009549&amp;t=k&amp;z=17">MAP</a>
Only £15
<h2>Women only... Sign up <a href="http://mztek.eventwax.com/cutting-it-up-laser-style-">HERE</a></h2>

<hr />]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>&quot;Quick, dirty, botched &amp; fun...how to get discarded machinery to do interesting things&quot;</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2010/11/quick-dirty-botched-funhow-to-get-discarded-machinery-to-do-interesting-things/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 06 Nov 2010 09:26:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=908</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Another fabulous techie workshop by MzTEK for women!

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/11/b-mztekwkshopnov2010-png.png"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-909" title="b-mztekwkshopnov2010-png" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/11/b-mztekwkshopnov2010-png.png" alt="b-mztekwkshopnov2010-png" width="360" height="255" /></a>

Think “scrap heap challenge” with house hold goods such as VCR’s, answermachine, clock radio’s, etc...

In this workshop you will be guided through how to hack appliances, find useful bits, bypass and rewire bits, whilst recognizing safety hazards and creating something wacky and wild at the same time!

It is recommend that you have rudimentary level of  experience in electronics for this workshop.

Workshop leader James Larson likes to do strange (and generally dangerous) things with electricity.

He is a regular Dorkbot presenter, and creator of such things as the VCR Cat Feeder, featured in Make-Digital, and the Kinky Boot Pong game.

Take a look at some of his inventions <a href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/technology/8172994.stm">HERE</a>

For this workshop we are looking for donations of VCR’s, clock radio’s, cordless telephones, answering machines, DVD players, Printers… let us know if you can bring any of these along to the workshop.
<h2>When &amp; Where</h2>
27th November  2010, 11am – 5pm, SPACE - 129—131 MARE STREET LONDON E8 3RH
<h2>Register</h2>
Only £20 to sign up. Email <a href="mailto:info@mztek.org">info@mztek.org</a> to register.]]></content:encoded>

<h2>MzTEK Winter Geekout!!!!!!!</h2>
Bring your projects and ideas to work on and share, or come and practice what you’ve learned from our previous workshops. We will have computers, previous workshop PDFs, and some tools and components available to borrow.

This will not be a tutored event, but an opportunity to play, learn and practice anything that takes your fancy, and to catch up on skills learned from previous MzTEK events! It is also a chance to present projects you may be working on (or have previously worked on), and get feedback.

	<item>
		<title>Laser Cutting Part Duex...</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2010/12/laser-cutting-part-duex/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 10 Dec 2010 11:57:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=926</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[For women... A workshop in cutting stuff up with a laser!

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/10/laser_kitties.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-medium wp-image-863" title="laser_kitties" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/10/laser_kitties-300x256.jpg" alt="laser_kitties" width="300" height="256" /></a>

Get your designs off the page and cut them out of acrylic, wood, paper, card or fabric… using the power of light!

If the thought of laser-cutting, circuit design and prototyping fills you with excitement and/or confusion, we have the perfect antidote for you!

Maybe you have seen cute acrylic jewellery, engraving, or delectable vinyl decals, or you have a world-changing invention that you have to figure out how to make the cogs and parts… then this is the place for you!

The workshop will consist of an intro to image formatting of designs, and laser cutting!

IMAGES:
Please feel free to bring with you some designs or pictures on paper or USB, as well as any materials to experiment with, but no more than 6mm thick and 24" x 18" wide (to fit the machine).

If you are familiar with vectors, please bring vector images rather than bitmaps of images.

MATERIALS:
There will be a limited amount of materials for you to experiment with, however if you have something in mind, you can find suitable materials from: Hamars on Bethnal Green road,
www.theplasticshop.co.uk and
4Dmodel shop at Tower Bridge
DO NOT USE: Polycarbonate, Fluoropolymers, Circuit board plastic, PTFE, Symalit.
SAFE TO USE: Acrylic, ABS, PETG, Nylon, Styrene, Polypromylene PPE
as well as card and paper.

For more information downlpad the workshop pdf <a href="http://www.mztek.org/workshop-material/">here </a>
<h2>When?</h2>
December 18th - 11am - 5pm
<h2>Where?</h2>
SMARTLAB, Knowledge Dock, Uni East London, Docklands Campus.
Nearest station is Cyprus on the DLR
<a href="http://maps.google.co.uk/maps?client=firefox-%20a&amp;hl=en&amp;ie=UTF8&amp;ll=51.507447,0.064341&amp;spn=0.003212,0.009549&amp;t=k&amp;z=17">MAP</a>
Only £15
<h2>Women only... Sign up <a href="http://mztek.eventwax.com/laser-cutting-part-duex">HERE</a></h2>

	<item>
		<title>RFID Music Toy</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2011/01/new-workshop-rfid-music-toy/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 05 Jan 2011 21:57:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=949</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="https://mztek.eventwax.com/rfid-music-toy-workshop/register"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-958" title="rfid_poster1" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/rfid_poster1.jpg" alt="rfid_poster1" width="530" height="500" /></a>
Learn how to use RFID technology to hack and make a musical friend out of your favourite stuffed toy!  We’ll be using RFID, Arduinos, and fluffy toys*.  Taught by interaction designer Artemis Papageorgiou.

<strong>When:</strong> 22 January 2011, 11:00am – 5:00pm

<strong>Where:</strong> Space Studios, 129‐131 Mare Street, London E8 3RH

<strong>Level: </strong> Low Intermediate - you will need to be somewhat familiar with Arduino.  Essentially, this class will not cover the basics on how to set up an Arduino.  We will learn to write code for RFID modules.

<strong>Materials</strong>:  We will be using a combination of RFID tags, readers, Arduinos and toys.  MzTEK is happy to lend all necessary materials (minus the toy*) on the day of the workshop, with the option to purchase them after.  Or, you can pre-order a kit through us without the arduino is £42, and <em>with</em> the arduino board is £65.  You must pre-order by January 13 2011 via <a href="mailto:info@mztek.org">email</a>.

<strong>To Register:</strong> The course costs £23 / student (does not include materials).   <em>This course is open only to women.</em>
<h2><a href="https://mztek.eventwax.com/rfid-music-toy-workshop/register">Register Now</a></h2>
Our classes fill up quickly due to demand, so be sure to register as soon as possible.

* BYOT:  Bring your own plush toy  ;)]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>DIY PACMAN </title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2011/01/pacman-diy/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 12 Jan 2011 12:21:57 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=969</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-103912.png"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-1000" title="screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-103912" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-103912-150x139.png" alt="" width="150" height="139" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-103920.png"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-1001" title="screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-103920" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-103920-150x141.png" alt="" width="150" height="141" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-104032.png"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-1002" title="screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-104032" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-104032-150x150.png" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></a></div>
<h2>Create LED light patterns for your own PACMAN game</h2>
Our fabulous February workshop covers how to use the basic electronic components (switch, potentiometer, resistor, capacitor etc) and introduce how to control a micro-controller, Atmega 168 using the open-source <a href="http://www. arduino.cc">Arduino software</a>.

In this workshop you will create your own lighting patterns, such as texts and images and also develop a simple game, using a bespoke pre-designed led-matrix circuit.

Check out this example video of the <a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/pacman_small.mov">DYI PACMAN</a> game
<h2>Where &amp; When</h2>
19th February 2011, 11am - 5pm, at <a href="http://www.spacestudios.org.uk/">SPACE</a>, Hackney, London,  E8 3RH
<h2>Materials Needed</h2>
All you will need is:
- a power supply (output: 12V, over 1A): Yes! Finally something to do  with all those old phone chargers! Please check your power chargers for a  mobile phone, a computer or other electronic devices.
- a laptop if you can, with <a href="http://www.arduino.cc/en/Main/Software">Arduino</a> software installed.
<h2>Prerequisites</h2>
No prior computer programming experience is needed.
<h2>To Register</h2>
As usual, this is a women only workshop.  The workshop is £35.00. Please register online <a href="https://mztek.eventwax.com/diy-pacman">here</a>.
<h2>The Instructor</h2>
This fantastic workshop will be lead by Eunjoo Shin, <a href="www.ejoo.org">www.ejoo.org</a>,  <a href="www.comms.me">www.comms.me</a> Eunjoo Shin, an artist, explores interaction design, sound and public  installation. Her art works have been featured in many venues, including  FILE festival 2009 in Sao Paulo, Peadhead at Lower Manhattan Cultural  Council in New York and Seoul Art Center in Seoul. Her work, Vocal Trio  was selected as one of the best interaction desgins by the Korean  Federation of Design Associations, and published in the design yearbook,  CREATIO 2009.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>MzTEK Guide to Programming</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2011/02/programming/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 20 Feb 2011 22:35:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>becky</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=1023</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/02/mztekprogramming.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1048 alignleft" title="mztekprogramming" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/02/mztekprogramming.jpg" alt="" width="243" height="234" /></a>Have you built something with Arduino or Processing?  Know how to find what you need to get a project working - you're a queen of copy&amp;paste - but wish you knew more about programming?

This short course will introduce the basics of computer programming, but it won't be a stuffy computer science lecture.  It will be a series of interactive sessions teaching programming by example.  <strong>This course is only open to women.</strong>

The type of questions we'll cover include:
<ul>
	<li>Why do we need to compile code?</li>
	<li>What's the difference between compiling and loading?</li>
	<li>Why are there ints, floats and chars?</li>
	<li>I've just downloaded some sample code, how do I understand what it's doing?</li>
</ul>
You'll also be able to bring in some code you just don't understand and we can all work it out together!
<h2>When &amp; Where</h2>
All sessions will be 7pm-9pm on Mondays the 14, 21 and 28 March  at <a href="http://www.spacestudios.org.uk/">SPACE</a>.
<h2>To Register</h2>
<a href="https://mztek.eventwax.com/the-mztek-guide-to-programming/register">The short course costs £60 (for 3 x 2 hour sessions).  You can register by clicking here.</a>
<h2>Prerequisites</h2>
Very little experience required.  If you've attended any previous MzTEK  workshop you're more than qualified.  We will be working with the  Arduino and Processing environments, so it is best if you've used them,  but if you've also done any other programming (e.g. HTML, Javascript,  Actionscript) you're welcome as well!
<h2>The Instructor</h2>
This short course will be taught by <a href="http://theleadingzero.com">Becky Stewart</a>.  Becky is a researcher with the Centre for Digital Music at Queen Mary, University of London where she recently completed her PhD in the School of Electronic Engineering and Computer Science.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Have you built something with Arduino or Processing? Know how to find what you need to get a project working - you're a queen of copy&paste - but wish you knew more about programming?  This short course will introduce the basics of computer programming, but it won't be a stuffy computer science lecture. ]]></excerpt:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Shiver My Teacup</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2011/03/shiver-my-teacups/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 07 Mar 2011 11:56:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=1066</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/03/a.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-thumbnail wp-image-1067" title="a" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/03/a-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" align="left" /></a>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/03/b.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-thumbnail wp-image-1068" title="b" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/03/b-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" align="left" /></a>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/03/c.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-thumbnail wp-image-1069" title="c" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/03/c-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" align="left" /></a>

We are very excited that our amazing April workshop will be held at the <a href="http://www.vam.ac.uk/school_stdnts/education_centre/index.html">V&amp;A Sackler Centre</a>.

Come and transform your favorite/least favorite teacup and saucer into an interactive art work which shivers when your tea is getting cold or shakes when you get too close!

Bring along your own teacup and saucer to modify using the Arduino board, sensors, motors and Arduino software.

This workshop is part of the MzTEK project <a title="Chi-TEK" href="/programs/chi-tek/">Chi-TEK</a>, a celebration of women working in arts and technology, and offers a tongue in cheek show case of what women can really achieve around a kitchen table.  A selection of teacups made in this workshop will be displayed as part of the Chi-TEK showcase in the V&amp;A Sackler Centre throughout September and October.
<h2>Post-workshop Materials</h2>
This was a fantastic workshop, a BIG thank you to Katrin for such an informative and fun day! And thanks too to Irini at the V&amp;A for being so helpful and letting us take over the art room for a day.

For anyone who would like to try this workshop at home, check out the Workshop Materials page <a href="http://www.mztek.org/workshop-material/">HERE</a>
<h2>Where &amp; When</h2>
Saturday 9 April 2011, 10.30-17.00
Victoria and Albert Museum, Sackler Centre
Cromwell Road, London SW7 2RL
<h2>Cost</h2>
£80, £64 concessions. All materials are provided, except the teacup and saucer, which students are required to bring.
<strong><a href="http://www.mztek.org/programs/chi-tek/raffle-to-win-a-place-on-shiver-my-teacup/">Or enter our raffle for a chance to win a free place!</a></strong>
<h2>To Register</h2>
All bookings to be made through the V&amp;A. Please call 020 7942 2211 to book or sign up through <a href="http://www.vam.ac.uk/activ_events/courses/courses/digital_courses/index.html">the web site</a>.
<h2>Prerequisites</h2>
This workshop is for women only.  No prior programming or electronics experience required but computer literacy essential.
<h2>The Instructor</h2>
This workshop will be lead by the amazing <a href="http://katrinbaumgarten.de/">Katrin Baumgarten</a>. Katrin is a recent graduate from the Royal College of Art and Imperial College London. Her projects revolve around human-technology-interaction and explore future possibilities within technology and art. She is enthusiastic and passionate about the cross-over of art, design and technology.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Come and transform your favorite/least favorite teacup and saucer into an interactive art work which shivers when your tea is getting cold or shakes when you get too close!  Bring along your own teacup and saucer to modify using the Arduino board, sensors, motors and Arduino software. ]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>The Chi-TEK Project</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2011/03/the-chi-tek-project/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 21 Mar 2011 11:39:09 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=1194</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[MzTEK is currently undertaking a new project—The Chi-TEK Project—to coincide with Digital Week and the Craft Council's Makers Fair this autumn.

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/03/teacups.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-1195" title="teacups" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/03/teacups.jpg" alt="" width="210" height="128" /></a>But you can already start to participate.  <a title="View the workshop" href="http://www.mztek.org/2011/03/shiver-my-teacups/"> Shiver My Teacup</a>, a workshop led by <a href="http://katrinbaumgarten.de/">Katrin Baumgarten</a>, will teach participants how to hack kitchen crockery with Arduinos and sensors. The final pieces will go on display at the V&amp;A Sackler Centre, alongside works by leading women in the fields of art and technology.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Raffle to Win a Place on Shiver My Teacup Workshop</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2011/03/raffle-to-win-a-place-on-shiver-my-teacup-workshop/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 28 Mar 2011 11:23:56 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=1238</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Would you like to register for the <a href="http://www.mztek.org/2011/03/shiver-my-teacups/">Shiver My Teacup</a> for as little as £3?  Buy a raffle ticket for a chance to win free registration -  an £80 value!

<span style="color: #999999;">[This raffle is now over]</span>

To enter, just give us some details below and pay £3 via Paypal by clicking below on the Pay Now button.  (To purchase multiple raffle tickets, update the quantity of tickets you would like.  Each ticket has an equal chance to win, more tickets means more chances.  Your odds of winning are dependent on the number of tickets you purchase and the total number of tickets purchased.)

<strong>We will draw a winner 5 April.</strong> If we have not received your payment by the time of the draw, you will not be eligible and will not be entered into the contest.  Anyone can enter the drawing, but only women can attend the workshop.  The winner can transfer the free workshop registration to someone else if they cannot attend themselves.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>DIY Pacman Workshop @ Future Everything</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2011/04/workshop_future-everything/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 08 Apr 2011 13:38:48 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=1246</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[MzTEK is coming to Manchester!  We are excited to be partnering with our old friends <a href="http://spacestudios.org.uk/">SPACE</a> to run our DIY PACMAN workshop in this years <a href="http://futureeverything.org">Future Everything</a> Festival of Art, Music and Culture.
<!--more-->
We will be participating in the festival as part of the <a href="http://futureeverything.org/art-overview/handmade/">Handmade</a>, digital craft fair taking place in Manchester's Victoria Baths.
<h2>The Workshop: DIY PACMAN</h2>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-104032.png"><img class="alignleft size-thumbnail wp-image-1002" title="screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-104032" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-104032-150x150.png" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-103920.png"><img class="alignleft size-thumbnail wp-image-1001" title="screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-103920" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-103920-150x141.png" alt="" width="150" height="141" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-103912.png"><img class="alignleft size-thumbnail wp-image-1000" title="screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-103912" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-103912-150x139.png" alt="" width="150" height="139" /></a>

Create LED light patterns for your own PACMAN game whilst learning how to use the basic electronic components (switch, potentiometer, resistor, capacitor etc) and introduce how to control a micro-controller, Atmega 168 using the open-source Arduino software.

In this workshop you will create your own lighting patterns, such as texts and images and also develop a simple game, using a bespoke pre-designed led-matrix circuit.
<h2>Where &amp; When</h2>
14th May 2011  - 10am - 4pm
Manchester's Victoria Baths
<h2>Materials Needed</h2>
All you will need is:
- a power supply (output: 12V, over 1A): Yes! Finally something to do with all those old power supplies!
- a laptop if you can, with Arduino software installed.
<h2>Prerequisites</h2>
No prior computer programming experience is needed.
<h2>To Register</h2>
As usual, this is a women only workshop.  Please contact Future Everything to register, <a href="http://futureeverything.org/art/diy-pacwoman-a-mztek-workshop-for-women/">http://futureeverything.org/art/diy-pacwoman-a-mztek-workshop-for-women/</a> .
<h2>The Instructor</h2>
This fantastic workshop will be lead by Eunjoo Shin, <a href="http://www.ejoo.org">www.ejoo.org</a>, <a href="http://www.comms.me">www.comms.me</a> Eunjoo Shin, an artist, explores interaction design, sound and public installation. Her art works have been featured in many venues, including FILE festival 2009 in Sao Paulo, Peadhead at Lower Manhattan Cultural Council in New York and Seoul Art Center in Seoul. Her work, Vocal Trio was selected as one of the best interaction desgins by the Korean Federation of Design Associations, and published in the design yearbook, CREATIO 2009.]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Kit &amp; Cakes Fundraiser at Digital Shoreditch</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2011/05/kit-cakes-fundraiser-at-digital-shoreditch/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 01 May 2011 16:40:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=1271</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/05/2210569000_2112344183.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1272 alignleft" title="pacman cupcakes" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/05/2210569000_2112344183-300x283.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="283" align="left" /></a>With <a title="Digital Shoreditch" href="http://digitalshoreditch.com/" target="_blank">Digital Shoreditch</a> just around the bend, we’re readying ourselves for our Family Day fundraiser, where we’ll sell delicious cupcakes and DIY Pacman tinker kits (comprised of an LED Matrix, circuit board, chips and buttons).

Come join us for a day of friendly digital festivities and help support MzTEK programming in the sweetest way!

Digital Shoreditch Family Day “provides an opportunity for local creatives, companies  and studios to exhibit outstanding digital interactives, installations  and artworks.”

Held on Sat 7th May @11:00 - 4:00 at <a href="http://maps.google.co.uk/maps?q=37+Batemans+Row,+London&amp;oe=utf-8&amp;client=firefox-a&amp;ie=UTF8&amp;hq=&amp;hnear=37+Bateman's+Row,+London+EC2A+3HH,+United+Kingdom&amp;gl=uk&amp;z=14&amp;ll=51.52518,-0.078771&amp;source=embed">Shoreditch Studios</a>, the event is free for children and £5 for adults to attend.

Hope to see you there!]]></content:encoded>

		<title>MzTEK @ Future Everything 2011</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2011/05/mztek-future-everything-2011/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 19 May 2011 14:16:13 +0000</pubDate>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://futureeverything.org/"><img src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/05/fe_logo_supersmall_w_on_b.jpg" alt="" title="fe_logo_supersmall_w_on_b" width="236" height="64" class="alignleft size-full wp-image-1300" /></a>

In case you were wondering what Future Everything is all about, check out this BBC video from the Handmade day, when we ran the DIY Pacduino (aka DIY Pacman/Pacwoman) in the beautiful Victoria Baths. We are in it! (for about 5 frames) :)

VIDEO HERE >>> <a href='http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-13443240' >BBC at Future Everything Handmade 2011</a>

Pictures coming soon to our Flickr group  HERE >>> <a href="http://www.flickr.com/groups/mztek/">http://www.flickr.com/groups/mztek/</a>

Cant wait til next year! ]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Chi-TEK Funding Campaign</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2011/06/chi-tek-funding-campaign/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Jun 2011 12:09:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=1338</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.mztek.org/programs/chi-tek/"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1339" title="Chi-TEK_banner11" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/banner11.png" alt="" width="550" height="170" /></a>

Please help raise money for Chi-TEK, a brilliant women's art and technology project by MzTEK, involving technologically modified teapots!

The project involves techi tea related workshops for women, a show case of tea pots and a tea party in the V&amp;A garden, which you are all invited to.

We have set up a sponsorship page here:  <a href="http://www.indiegogo.com/Chi-TEK">http://www.indiegogo.com/Chi-TEK</a> with a chance to get a limited edition Chi-TEK goodie as a thank you. ;o)

There are only have 10 days to go, so don't miss out!

<!--more-->
This autumn MzTEK will be launching Chi-TEK, a celebration of women working at the intersection of art and technology.

Chi-TEK will bring you an inspiring showcase of technically modified teapots in the V&amp;A Sackler Centre, tea related workshops, and the Chi-TEK Tea Party, open to the public in the V&amp;A garden.

Our aim is to promote women's contributions to technology in the arts.  What better way than through highly visible and fun events and workshops?

We need your finical help to ensure this goes off with the bang it deserves.

There are perks for your contribution too - limited edition Chi-TEK badges, tea towels and mugs. Don't miss out!

To find out more about our campaign, please visit our funding page at <a href="http://www.indiegogo.com/Chi-TEK">http://www.indiegogo.com/Chi-TEK</a>

Leave us a comment on our funding page to help us get featured on the front page of indieGoGo, to reach an even wider audience.

Thanks for all your support,

All at MzTEK]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Come find us at the Barbican Weekender: Extraordinary Voices</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2011/06/barbican-weekender-extraordinary-voices/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 27 Jun 2011 12:21:42 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=1348</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/make-a-mic.png">
<span style="color: #000000; font-size: 23px; line-height: 35px;">Come and join MzTEK on the July 23rd &amp; 24th at the </span></a><a href="http://www.barbican.org.uk/education/event-detail.asp?ID=12054">Barbican's Extraordinary Voices</a> weekend of events and workshops.

<img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-1391" title="barbican-logo" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/barbican-logo.gif" alt="" width="194" height="84" />

<!--more-->

MzTEK will be running two drop-in workshops all weekend, free for all the family. Come and find us in the main foyer in front of the fountains.
<h2>What Does Your Face Sound Like? readings by MzTEK Meg</h2>
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/WhatFaceSoundsmall.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1351 aligncenter" title="What Does Your Face Sound Like?" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/WhatFaceSoundsmall.png" alt="" width="300" height="344" /></a></p>
MzTEK Meg (aka <a href="http:/www.mztek.org/mztek-unplugged-julie-freeman/" target="_blank">Julie Freeman</a>) presents the fantastically farcical yet fully functional facial translator. Step into the booth and have your face captured and transformed into a sonic sequence of sampled speech. Hear your face! Make it your ringtone!

FIND YOUR FACES AT <a href="http://www.mztek.org/meg">www.mztek.org/meg</a>

AND...
<h2>MAKE-A-MIC</h2>
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/make-a-mic.png"><img class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-1498" title="make-a-mic" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/make-a-mic-1024x204.png" alt="" width="576" height="114" /></a></p>
Ever wondered what makes a microphone hum? Come and make a mic, and add you're own tune to the mix!

Join <a href="http://www.ejoo.org/" target="_blank">Eunjoo Shin</a> (previously known to MzTEK for <a href="http://www.mztek.org/2011/01/pacman-diy/" target="_blank">DIY Pacduino</a>), and Sophie McDonald (also known for her <a href="http://www.sketchpatch.net" target="_blank">sketchPatch</a> workshops) for MAKE-A-MIC! Learn how to wire up a jack with a piezo transducer to make your very own microphone, or musical instrument. Then join our rock band and crank it up real loud! You will have a chance to collaborate with other participants to produce a cacophony of musical eloquence.
<h2>When &amp; Where</h2>
Find us in the main foyer of the Barbican Centre on July 23rd &amp; 24th.
These workshop are open to the public, and will run from 11am - 4pm Saturday and Sunday as part of <a href="http://www.barbican.org.uk/education/event-detail.asp?ID=12054">the Barbican Weekender - Extraordinary Voices.</a>

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Come and join MzTEK on the July 23rd & 24th at the Barbican's Extraordinary Voices weekend of events and workshops.

MzTEK will be running two free drop-in workshops all weekend, fun for all the family.]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1348</wp:post_id>

	<item>
		<title>Chi-TEK Fever!</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2011/06/chi-tek-fever/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 29 Jun 2011 18:05:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=1424</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h2 style="text-align: left;">How to tell your tea's temperature is coming down.</h2>
<p style="text-align: left;">&nbsp;</p>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/ThermoTeaPotx500.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1425" title="TempTeaPot" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/ThermoTeaPotx500.jpg" alt="" width="500" height="350" /></a>
<h2 style="text-align: center;">Join in Chi-TEK - get your teapot hacks to us at info@mztek.org and we'll post them on our website :)</h2>
&nbsp;

Just a quick hack I made up today :) Really good for showing that you should be getting on with some tea drinking before it's to late!

We'd like to say a big thanks to our friends at <a href="http://sugru.com/">sugru</a>! They have given us a load of packs of <a href="http://sugru.com/">sugru</a> to give away with donations to our Chi-TEK project. :)  Thats the green stuff sticking the thermometer to the side of the teapot.  It's indestructible when it sets, so will stay on through the wash and is heat proof - which is good for teapots.

<a href="http://www.indiegogo.com/Chi-TEK">Get a sample of sugru when you donate £10 to Chi-TEK! </a> :)

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/Julie_at_work_on_her_teapot_Small.jpg"><img src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/Julie_at_work_on_her_teapot_Small.jpg" alt="" title="Julie_at_work_on_her_teapot_Small" width="500" height="333" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1450" /></a>]]></content:encoded>
