	<item>
		<title>Chi-TEK Teapot: A Biohacked Tea Cosy by Anna Dumitriu</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/Biohacked_Tea_Cosy</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 22 Aug 2011 17:04:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=1554</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<em>Post by Anna Dumitriu (<a href="http://www.normalflora.co.uk" target="_blank">www.normalflora.co.uk</a>)</em>
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/TeaCosy11.jpg"><img title="TeaCosy1" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/TeaCosy11-300x199.jpg" alt="Bio Hacked Teacosy" width="577" height="398" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: left;">I struggled long and hard with the issue of what to do with the plain, white and highly uninspiring teapot I received in the post from MzTEK several months ago, mulling a series of scenarios in my head over and over again. I am very supporting of MzTEK and their aims and was really happy to be involved. But when I opened up the parcel my heart slightly sank.</p>
I considered taking a Pico projector apart and trying to get the teapot to project tea pouring from the spout when tilted (cool but too expensive considering the risk of breaking the projector), turning the teapot into a piece of lab equipment (nice but would that work within the constraints of a ‘tea party’ and what would it do?), smashing it and rebuilding it as a bionic version or simply strapping it to a robot chassis so it would roll up and down the table. None of these ideas really convinced me though. It felt like a backwards way of working. Usually the overall concept and the final artwork are intrinsically linked for me from the very start. This constraint of the teapot felt exceptionally restricting, like I was back at school working on a project with a brief. If I was a designer then it might have made sense, but I am not, I’d probably describe myself as a kind of ‘conceptual artist’, I often make tangible objects but they are always very much ideas led.

My art practice is really centred on two main areas of very much linked research. I work with microbiology, I am currently Leverhulme Artist is Residence on the Modernising Medical Microbiology Project, University of Oxford who are looking at how transmission of pathogenic bacteria operates, what (near) real-time whole genome mapping of bacteria can tell us and also with robotics, working in partnership with the University of Hertfordshire’s Adaptive Systems Group. The themes that reoccur in my work are the microbiological life, artificial life, ethics and public engagement in science (which I view as a political issue considering how much misinformation is put out by the media). I make installations, interventions and performances using a range of digital, biological and traditional media including live bacteria, interactive technologies and textiles.

Finally I started to think deeply about tea itself and its properties. Since the beginning of the year I have been experimenting with dyeing embroidery silks with natural and man-made antibiotics: from turmeric to Vancomycin. My recent work the “MRSA Quilt” uses the tools we have against this well-known hospital pathogen in combination with fabric stained with actual MRSA bacteria (grown on chromogenic agar). For instance the polka dots on the quilt fabric are made with Vancomycin susceptibility disks (the way they can tell in the lab if a bacterium can be treated with that drug). I remembered that green tea is a natural antibiotic and an effective dye and started to think about that.

I began to try to culture a green tea resistant bacterium and to use it as a stain. I had previously developed an embroidery using green tea stained thread and it occurred to me that I could use kitchen/lab technology to create a textile piece that was stained with bacteria (sourced from tea, biscuits and cake) in interplay with the green tea’s antibiotic effects. Additional later embroidery is impregnated with negligible amounts of Vancomycin. The bacterial culture medium (Dr Simon Park’s “Park’s Kitchen Agar”) was created from supermarket ingredients and lab equipment was sourced from the local pound shop (and ebay). I had a failed attempt trying to culture Lactobacillus when I discovered they are microaerophiles and not likely to grow in air and at one point I went crazy and crumbled a chocolate biscuit on it. After 2 days I had signs of life and then went away for the weekend. Upon my return I had even more of signs of life and moulds had started to take over, sending their filaments deep into the cloth. Finally I made it safe and killed off all that life. Taking no chances I used surgical spirit, boiling water, mould killer and pasteurization, so that should do the trick. Pasteurization (originally developed by pioneering microbiologist Louis Pasteur to stop wine from spoiling) should be enough in itself but the mould killer will do for any spores remaining after rinsing. The risk of culturing anything nasty was also severely limited by the fact that all the bacteria were sourced from tea and biscuits and cultured at around 20 degrees Celsius (much less than the human body temperature).

The embroidery shows my first attempt at ‘Cutwork’, which is a technique, where in portions of cloth are cut away and the resulting ‘hole’ is reinforced and filled with embroidery. I wanted to do this as I have also embedded a video screen in the work, showing my processes. I was quite intimidated in many ways to think my embroidery would be shown in the V &amp; A Museum, alongside so many of the world’s best textile works. But for me working in embroidery is a conceptual choice rather than a demonstration of my craft skills.

Around the time of the enlightenment the perversely difficult practice of whitework embroidery was considered to be one of the highest levels of achievement for a woman. They would sew in the evenings by candlelight straining their eyes to see the tiny stitches, hunched over their embroidery hoops, their bodies twisted and constricted by tight corsetry, one pinprick of blood meaning the whole piece would be ruined. This coincided with the period in which many of their male counterparts started to become ‘gentleman scientists’ beginning to rigorously study the world around them ‘scientifically’. This was the time when the scientific method was developed and disciplinary boundaries were drawn between art and science. I’ve made several large whitework embroidered pieces inspired by these ideas which for me is a way to consider paradigmatic changes in the process of research and current moves towards transdisciplinarity, alongside a consideration of what ‘feminine’ approaches to science and technology might mean.

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/teacosy21.jpg"><img title="Bio Hacked Tea Cosy by Anna Dumitriu" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/teacosy21.jpg" alt="" width="641" height="448" /></a>
<p style="text-align: left;">Finally the textile pieces were stitched together to create what I am guessing is the first ever bio-hacked tea cosy/video installation!<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/teacosy21.jpg">
</a></p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[I started to think deeply about tea itself and its properties. Since the beginning of the year I have been experimenting with dyeing embroidery silks with natural and man-made antibiotics: from turmeric to Vancomycin. My recent work the “MRSA Quilt” uses the tools we have against this well-known hospital pathogen in combination with fabric stained with actual MRSA bacteria (grown on chromogenic agar). For instance the polka dots on the quilt fabric are made with Vancomycin susceptibility disks (the way they can tell in the lab if a bacterium can be treated with that drug). I remembered that green tea is a natural antibiotic and an effective dye and started to think about that.]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1554</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2011-08-22 17:04:34</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2011-08-22 17:04:34</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>chi-tek-teapot-biohacked-tea-cosy-by-anna-dumitriu</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="anna-dumitriu"><![CDATA[Anna Dumitriu]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="bio-hacking"><![CDATA[bio hacking]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="chi-tek"><![CDATA[Chi-TEK]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="chitek"><![CDATA[Chi-TEK]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="chi-tek-artist"><![CDATA[Chi-TEK Artist]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="diy-bio"><![CDATA[DIY bio]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="teapot"><![CDATA[Teapot]]></category>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_edit_last</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[4]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>custom_permalink</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Biohacked_Tea_Cosy]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>The Chi-TEK Teapots are coming in...</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2011/08/teapots-coming-in/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 30 Aug 2011 19:08:14 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=1604</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<em>We are getting really excited about the artwork that is coming in.</em>  Take a look at some of the pieces that will be on display over the next 3 months in the Sackler Centre in the V&amp;A, and in our garden Tea Party on 24 &amp; 25  September (hosted at the V&amp;A’s <a title="Digital Design Weekend" href="http://www.vam.ac.uk/whatson/event/1276/">Digital Design Weekend</a>).

<strong>Tine Bech<strong>’s</strong> <em>The Lightpot</em></strong><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Tine01.jpg"><img title="Tine01" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Tine01.jpg" alt="" width="584" height="436" /></a>
<p style="clear: both;"><strong>Shu Lea’s <em>Stormy Weather Teapot</em></strong></p>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/shu_lea03.png"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1627" title="shu_lea03" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/shu_lea03-300x224.png" alt="" width="189" height="141" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/shu_lea01.png"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1628" title="shu_lea01" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/shu_lea01-300x224.png" alt="" width="189" height="141" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/shu_lea02.png"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1629" title="shu_lea02" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/shu_lea02-300x223.png" alt="" width="189" height="141" /></a>
<p style="clear: both;">Shu Lea found this yellow Tetley teapot laying quietly among vintage silver Morrocan teapots in the cupboard at the home of madame Rokia Ben Brahim, a 93 year old Algerian woman working all her life as a cleaning lady in Paris. Inside is soldered a Vive la Resistance aka NanoSmano Sajica , a mini circuit with an oscillator and a resistive gas sensor. It produces sound responding to touch and breath.</p>
<p style="clear: both;"><strong> Artemis Papageorgiou<strong>’s</strong> <em>This Is Not A Teapot</em></strong></p>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/artemis_teapot01.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1607" title="artemis_teapot01" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/artemis_teapot01-300x225.jpg" alt="" width="180" height="135" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Chi-TEKArtemisPapageorgiou021.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1606" title="Chi-TEKArtemisPapageorgiou02" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Chi-TEKArtemisPapageorgiou021-300x225.jpg" alt="" width="180" height="135" /></a>  <a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Chi-TEKArtemisPapageorgiou01.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1608" title="Chi-TEKArtemisPapageorgiou01" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Chi-TEKArtemisPapageorgiou01-300x225.jpg" alt="" width="180" height="135" /></a>
<p style="clear: both;"><a href="http://artemispapageorgiou.wordpress.com/2011/08/03/this-is-not-a-teapot/" target="_blank">This Is Not A Teapot</a> is inspired by the semiotics of language used in the homonym painting of Magritte (Ceci n’est pas une pipe).  You can read more about Artemis's project on her website at <a href="http://artemispapageorgiou.wordpress.com" target="_blank">http://artemispapageorgiou.wordpress.com</a></p>
<p style="clear: both;"><strong>Mika Satomi<strong>’s</strong> <em><a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/14412219@N04/6032867050/in/photostream/" target="_blank">Self-destructing Teapot</a></em></strong></p>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Mika_02.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1619" title="Mika_02" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Mika_02-300x225.jpg" alt="" width="162" height="122" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Mika_03.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1618" title="Mika_03" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Mika_03-300x225.jpg" alt="" width="180" height="135" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Mika_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1617 alignnone" title="Mika_01" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Mika_01-300x225.jpg" alt="" width="180" height="135" /></a>
<p style="clear: both;">Mika's teapot constantly hits itself with nails, and is on the verge of self destructing. See <a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/14412219@N04/6032867050/in/photostream/" target="_blank">the tea pot in action here</a>.</p>
<p style="clear: both;"><strong>Anna Dumitriu<strong>’s</strong> <em><a href="http://www.mztek.org/Biohacked_Tea_Cosy">Biohacked Tea Cosy</a></em></strong></p>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/TeaCosy11.jpg"><img title="TeaCosy1" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/TeaCosy11-300x199.jpg" alt="Bio Hacked Teacosy" width="293" height="194" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/teacosy21.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1569" title="teacosy2" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/teacosy21-300x199.jpg" alt="" width="287" height="190" /></a>
<p style="clear: both;"><a href="http://www.mztek.org/Biohacked_Tea_Cosy">Read more about Anna's experience</a> of making her Biohacked Tea Cosy for Chi-TEK here.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>The Chi-TEK Tea Party Showcase</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2011/09/the-chi-tek-tea-party-display/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 04 Sep 2011 19:19:42 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sally</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=1716</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This week, we're very excited to unveil the <a title="Chi-TEK" href="http://mztek.org/chi-tek">Chi-TEK Tea Party</a> showcase in the V&amp;A Sackler Centre.

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/chitek_600.png"><img title="chitek_600" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/chitek_600.png" alt="" width="531" height="390" /></a>
<br clear="all" />
The Tea Party is a fun, surprising showcase of tea pots specially hacked, modified, and redesigned by 20 leading women designers, artists, and technologists.  <a href="http://www.mztek.org/programs/chi-tek/participating-artists/">Read more about the artists</a>.

Then, join us on 24 &amp; 25 September during London Design Festival and Digital Weekend at the Victoria &amp; Albert Museum, where we will throw a very unusual type of tea party in the gardens.  More details on that to come.

Meantime, <a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/14412219@N04/6032867050/in/faves-39231074@N00/">checkout a destructive teapot  </a>from designer Mika Satomi (of <a href="http://www.kobakant.at/">KOBAKANT</a>).  Then head on over to <a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/37996583811@N01/6097454926/in/photostream">artist Rain Ashford's Flickr</a> for a sneak peek at TeaPotty.

We can't wait to set these up this week for display!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>DIY Pacduino Workshop, V&amp;A Museum</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2011/08/diy-pacduino-workshop-the-va-museum/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 20 Oct 2011 10:44:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=1667</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-103912.png"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-1000" title="screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-103912" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-103912-150x139.png" alt="" width="150" height="139" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-103920.png"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-1001" title="screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-103920" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-103920-150x141.png" alt="" width="150" height="141" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-104032.png"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-1002" title="screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-104032" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/screen-shot-2011-01-14-at-104032-150x150.png" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></a></div>
<h2>Create LED light patterns or program your own PACMAN-like game.</h2>
This fabulous workshop covers how to use the basic electronic components (switch, potentiometer, resistor, capacitor etc) and introduce how to control a micro-controller, Atmega 168 using the open-source <a href="http://www. arduino.cc">Arduino software</a>.

In this workshop you will create your own lighting patterns, such as texts and images and also develop a simple game, using a bespoke pre-designed led-matrix circuit.

Check out this example video of the <a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/pacman_small.mov">DIY PACMAN</a> game
<h2>Where &amp; When</h2>
5 November - 10am  - 4.30pm

<a href="http://www.vam.ac.uk/content/articles/s/sackler-centre-for-arts-education-at-the-vanda/">V&amp;A Museum Sackler Centre</a>, South Kensington, London
<h2>Prerequisites</h2>
- a power supply (output: 12V, over 1A): Yes! Finally something to do with all those old phone chargers! Please check your power chargers for a mobile phone, a computer or other electronic devices.

No prior computer programming experience is needed.
<h2>To Register</h2>
As usual, this is a women only workshop.  All bookings to be made through the V&amp;A.
Tickets are £80 or £64 concession
Please call 020 7942 2211 to book or sign up through <a href="http://www.vam.ac.uk/whatson/event/1452/retro-gaming-2556/">the web site</a>.
<h2>The Instructor</h2>
This fantastic workshop will be lead by Eunjoo Shin, <a href="www.ejoo.org">www.ejoo.org</a>, <a href="www.comms.me">www.comms.me</a> Eunjoo Shin, an artist, explores interaction design, sound and public installation. Her art works have been featured in many venues, including FILE festival 2009 in Sao Paulo, Peadhead at Lower Manhattan Cultural Council in New York and Seoul Art Center in Seoul. Her work, Vocal Trio was selected as one of the best interaction desgins by the Korean Federation of Design Associations, and published in the design yearbook, CREATIO 2009.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Musique Concrète</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/Musique_Concrete</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 08 Nov 2011 16:41:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=1672</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Musique concrète ("concrete music" or "real music") utilises sound as a compositional resource in unusual ways. The material does not have to be exclusively derived from musical instruments or voices, nor to elements traditionally thought of as "musical" (melody, harmony, rhythm, tempo and so on).

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/Daphne276.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-medium wp-image-1950" title="Daphne276" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/Daphne276-300x180.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="180" /></a>

<strong>A full day exploring experimental sound and composition.</strong>

Explore the history of Musique concrète, and create your very own masterpiece in a day. Learn the basics of simple recording techniques, and then test your skills on a group sound walk.

Back at the studio you will learn to transfer your material to computer and edit it using Audacity, into a short music composition. Using basic compositional methods and processing.

Bring your own recording device and headphones, such as a dictaphone, small handheld recorder or phone.

This workshop is lead by Leslie Deere, an artist working with sound. Her work can currently be heard at Kew Gardens, where she has two sound installations running daily. Leslie comes from a performing arts background in dance and has been inspired by Merce Cunningham and John Cage. She has a BA in Sonic Arts and an MA in Communication Art &amp; Design from the Royal College of Art.
<h2> Where</h2>
<a href="http://www.spacestudios.org.uk/">SPACE
</a>129—131 MARE STREET
LONDON E8 3RH

&nbsp;
<h2>When</h2>
Decmber 10th 2011
10.30am - 4.30pm
<h2>Register</h2>
This workshop if £25.
As usual, this is a women only workshop.

SIGN UP HERE: <a href="https://mztek.eventwax.com/musique-concrte">https://mztek.eventwax.com/musique-concrte</a>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>MzTEK Invites you to tea...</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2011/09/mztek-invites-you-to-tea/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 17 Sep 2011 12:00:27 +0000</pubDate>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="text-align: center;"></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"></p>
<p style="text-align: left;">The <a title="MzTEK Invites you to tea…" href="http://mztek.org/chi-tek">Chi-TEK Tea Party</a> at the V&amp;A Digital Design Weekend / London Design Festival 2011

<a href="http://mztek.org/chi-tek"><img class="aligncenter" src="http://mztek.org/html_email/images/page1.png" alt="Chi-TEK Tea Party Flyer" width="600" height="843" /></a></p>
Saturday 24 &amp; Sunday 25 September 2011

11:00 - 16:30

Tea, cake, and a brilliant display of hacked / modified tea pots.

Celebrate the talent and innovation women bring to arts and technology.  Come join MzTEK in a weekend of tea &amp; cake, tinkering, play, and an electric showcase of interactive teapots.

This event is free.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Chi-TEK Workshop Festival for Women</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/Chi-FEST</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 04 Oct 2011 10:59:31 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=1812</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h2>A day of introductory techy workshops for women</h2>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/10/flyer_logoinWORKSHOP2forweb.png"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1816" title="flyer_logoinWORKSHOP2forweb" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/10/flyer_logoinWORKSHOP2forweb.png" alt="" width="500" height="710" /></a>

MzTEK has teamed up with our friends at <a href="http://schoolofeverything.com">School of Everything</a> to bring you a day of techy tinkering.

Workshops include Shiver My Tea Cups, Make-a-Mic &amp; Soft Circuit Ghosts. The day will be structured for you to chose 3x 1hour 30mins workshops to attend throughout day. Spend the day picking up skills in Arduino, soldering, noise making, sensors &amp; more!

No experience necessary - just enthusiasm for tech, and tea!

<em>This workshop is part of the MzTEK project <a title="Chi-TEK" href="http://www.mztek.org/programs/chi-tek/">Chi-TEK</a>, a celebration of women working in arts and technology, and offers a tongue in cheek take on what women can really achieve around a kitchen table.</em>

<!--more-->

<iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/25837263?title=0&amp;byline=0&amp;portrait=0" frameborder="0" width="400" height="265"></iframe>

<a href="http://vimeo.com/25837263">Soft Circuit Voodoo Doll</a> from <a href="http://vimeo.com/user7323498">Becky Stewart</a> on <a href="http://vimeo.com">Vimeo</a>.
<h2>Bring with you...</h2>
Your favourite teacup and saucer
If you have a laptop, please bring along with you.
If you have an Arduino, bringing this will mean you can take your work away with you.
<h2>The Instructors:</h2>
<a href="http://katrinbaumgarten.de/">Katrin Baumgarten</a> is a recent graduate from the Royal College of Art and Imperial College London. Her projects revolve around human-technology-interaction and explore future possibilities within technology and art. <a href="http://katrinbaumgarten.de/" target="_blank">katrinbaumgarten.de</a>

<a href="http://www.translatingnature.org" target="_blank">Julie Freeman</a> explores relationships between science, technology and nature and how we perceive and interact with them. Julie recently became a TED Fellow 2011.  <a href="http://www.translatingnature.org" target="_blank">translatingnature.org</a>

<a href="http://theleadingzero.com" target="_blank">Becky Stewart</a> from MzTEK currently runs her own company, <a href="http://www.codasign.com/" target="_blank">Codasign</a> as researcher, designer and consultant for digital music installations.
<h2>Cost:</h2>
Standard ticket £65.
<strong>MzTEK Special </strong>buy 1 ticket and get a second half price - <strong>bring a friend!</strong> - enter this promo code when registering: <strong>241.5  NOTE: you will need to add the code on the registration form, before you get to the ticket options.</strong>
This is a women only workshop. Booking Essential.
<h2><a href="https://mztek.eventwax.com/chi-tek-workshop-fest">BOOK HERE NOW!</a></h2>
To book, go to <a href="https://mztek.eventwax.com/chi-tek-workshop-fest">mztek.eventwax.com/chi-tek-workshop-fest</a>
<h2>Location:</h2>
<a href="http://schoolofeverything.com/">School of Everything</a>  Limehouse Town Hall  646 Commercial Road  London E14 7HA

For more info or any questions, please feel free to get in touch at info@mztek.org

The Chi-TEK project is supported by

<img class="alignnone" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/themes/pixel_perfect/images/logo_lottery.jpg" alt="" width="144" height="106" />      <img class="alignnone" src="http://mztek.org/html_email/chitek_invite/images/logo_space.png" alt="" width="150" height="38" />      <a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/10/SoE_logo_big.gif"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1834" title="SoE_logo_big" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/10/SoE_logo_big.gif" alt="" width="172" height="83" /></a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>T-Hack with G.HACK</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2011/11/t-hack-with-g-hack/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 10 Nov 2011 10:42:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=1850</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/ghack_logo1.png"><img title="ghack_logo1" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/ghack_logo1-300x157.png" alt="" width="300" height="157" /></a>

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/10/ghack_teapot.png"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1851" title="ghack_teapot" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/10/ghack_teapot.png" alt="" width="570" height="376" /></a>

G.Hack is an art and technology lab for women at Queen Mary University of London. They are participating artists in the Chi-TEK project, and have developed an interactive table for sound mapping tea houses across London.

This workshop will teach basic techniques involved in the construction of an interactive table top, using infrared sensors. It will also teach basic sound recording and editing, the basics of soldering components, as well as covering simple programming for the interactive table using Processing, MaxMsp and reacTIVision software.

<iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/28329472?title=0&amp;byline=0&amp;portrait=0" frameborder="0" width="400" height="300"></iframe>

<a href="http://vimeo.com/28329472">G.Hack - Teapot - Sound Mapping London Tea Houses</a> from <a href="http://vimeo.com/mat10">MAT_OPEN</a> on <a href="http://vimeo.com">Vimeo</a>.
<h2>What to bring with you (if you can)...</h2>
Participants are required to bring their own laptops, and if possible with preinstalled sound editing software, <a href="http://processing.org/">Processing</a>, <a href="http://reactivision.sourceforge.net/">reacTIVision</a> and <a href="http://cycling74.com/downloads/">MaxMsp</a> (demo licence is fully functional for 30 days) and if you have it, sound recording equipment. All materials for making sensors will be provided.
<h2>When:</h2>
November 19th 2011

10.30am – 4.30pm
<h2>Where:</h2>
SPACE
129 -131 Mare St
London E8 3RH    - <a href="http://maps.google.co.uk/maps?hl=en&amp;tab=wl">MAP</a>
<h2>Booking</h2>
This is a women only workshop
Tickets are £25
Register here: <a href="https://mztek.eventwax.com/t-hack-with-ghack">https://mztek.eventwax.com/t-hack-with-ghack</a>

This Chi-TEK workshop project is supported by

<img src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/themes/pixel_perfect/images/logo_lottery.jpg" alt="" width="144" height="106" />      <img src="http://mztek.org/html_email/chitek_invite/images/logo_space.png" alt="" width="150" height="38" />

	<item>
		<title>Geekout at Hub Westminster&#039;s Changemakers&#039; Fayre 2011</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2011/10/geekout-at-hub-westminsters-changemakers-fayre-2011/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 24 Oct 2011 22:32:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Em</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=1876</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/10/picforgeekouts.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1880 alignleft" title="" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/10/picforgeekouts.jpg" alt="" width="539" height="359" /></a>

MzTEK invites you to our Geekout - a session which encourages you to work on your own tech projects in a peer to peer environment, share your ideas and most of all, tinker!

If you require one, please bring your own laptop as well as any materials for pieces you're working on. We'll have solder irons, glue guns, some components and also learning materials from previous workshops. There will be a couple of tutored exercises, including an introduction to <a href="http://www.sketchpatch.net/">SketchPatch</a> and how to make your own <a href="http://vimeo.com/25837263">Soft Circuit Voodoo Doll</a>.

We would like to thank <a href="http://blip.fm/barryslounge">Barry's Lounge </a>for sponsoring our Geekout :)
<h2>What to bring with you (if you can)...</h2>
Your own laptop
<h2>When:</h2>
October 27th 2011

8:00pm - 11:00pm
<h2>Where:</h2>
Hosted by Hub Westminster
1st floor New Zealand House
80 Haymarket
London
SW1Y 4TE   -   <a href="http://maps.google.co.uk/maps?q=SW1Y+4TE&amp;um=1&amp;hl=en&amp;biw=1364&amp;bih=856&amp;ie=UTF-8&amp;sa=N&amp;tab=il">MAP</a>
<h2>Booking</h2>
This is a women only session
Tickets for the fayre are free and can be booked <a href="http://changemakersfayre.eventbrite.com/">here</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Moving Forest </title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2011/11/moving-forest/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 09 Nov 2011 16:04:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=1903</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/10/hackworkshops.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1930" title="" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/10/hackworkshops.jpg" alt="" width="520" height="306" /></a></p>
MzTEK has teamed up with AKA the castle to present an open hardware hack workshop as part of <a href="http://www.movingforest.net/">Moving Forest</a> London2012 initiative by AKA the castle.

MzTEK is hosting a two day open hardware hack workshop focusing on modifying/remodelling /hacking recycled hardware for generating revolting noise, based on the Chip Tune Marching Band workshop for creating a portably powered sound circuit.

Planning for Moving Forest's citywide insurgency acts with updated moving antennas replacing moving tree branches, these workshops also strategize a massive mobilization of london urbanites as part of Moving Forest's distributed performance for London summer 2012.

Moving Forest is a 12 hour, five act, visual, sonic, digital, electronic and urban performance collectively realized by AKA the castle, a temporal performance troupe bringing together visual artists, writers, soundists, silk threaders, codedecoders, macromikro, boombox mass, mobile agents, wifi fielders and urbanites. 12 hours of sonic, coded action map an imaginary Castle and camouflage forest revolt onto a given modern day metropolis.

Moving Forest  was first presented at Transmediale.08 in Berlin.

The partners for Moving Forest London workshop development are MA Interactive Media &amp; Centre for Cultural Studies at Goldsmiths, University of London, Furtherfield, Space, Digital Programmes, V&amp;A.

Please bring your own devices and tools to modify/remodel/hack, there will be a £10 pound workshop fee to cover the sound making electronic supplies.
<h2>WHEN</h2>
Take part in a one or two day workshop session 26 &amp; 27 November.
11am to 5pm, November 26,  Saturday
11am to 5pm, November 27,  Sunday
<h2>SIGN UP</h2>
This is a women only workshop. £10 on the door to cover basic noise making kit.

Please sign up on the <a href="http://scrying.org/doku.php?id=hack">Moving Forest hack wiki</a> to take part in one or two day workshop sessions or write to <a href="mailto:now@movingforest.net">now@movingforest.net</a>
<h2>WHERE</h2>
<a href="http://www.spacestudios.org.uk/">SPACE</a>
129-131 MARE STREET
LONDON E8 3RH
+44(0)20 8525 4330]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Soft Circuit Ghosts Instructions</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/soft-circuit-ghosts</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 07 Nov 2011 17:14:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>becky</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=1935</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Soft circuit ghosts were one of the mini-workshops run during Chi-Fest a couple weeks ago.  The instructions were requested by those that wanted to make more of them at home or couldn't attend the workshop.

<img src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/11/2011-10-21-12.49.11-300x225.jpg" alt="soft circuit ghost" title="Soft Circuit Ghost" width="300" height="225" class="aligncenter size-medium wp-image-1938" />

<a href='http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/11/softcircuitghosts.pdf'>The instructions be downloaded here.</a>

Most of the materials you can find at any haberdashery.  The conductive thread and fabric can be found online, we ordered ours for the workshop from <a href="http://www.mindsetsonline.co.uk/index.php?cPath=418_6_572">Mindsets.</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>MzTEK&#039;s new home at C4CC</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2012/01/mzteks-new-home-at-c4cc/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 14 Jan 2012 12:13:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=1978</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>We are now based at the <a href="http://www.creativecollaboration.org.uk" target="_blank">Centre for Creative Collaboration</a>! </strong>
The good people of C4CC invited us to join a community of creatives, researchers, freelancers and SME's at their awesome space in Kings Cross.

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/01/c4cc.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-medium wp-image-1979" title="c4cc" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/01/c4cc-300x200.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="200" /></a>

C4CC is a new initiative in collaboration for London. It’s a pilot project and a prototype for a bigger idea. They are bringing together leading and innovative researchers from London’s universities and colleges, creative industry practitioners and freelancers, SMEs and students.
<p style="text-align: left;"><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/01/Screen-shot-2012-01-14-at-11.54.48.png"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1980 alignnone" title="Screen shot 2012-01-14 at 11.54.48" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/01/Screen-shot-2012-01-14-at-11.54.48.png" alt="" width="475" height="268" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: left;">Feel free to pop in on Friday mornings for <a href="http://tuttleclub.wordpress.com/" target="_blank">Tuttle</a>, a friendly networking event.</p>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Whats next...</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2012/01/whats-next/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 14 Jan 2012 13:16:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[&nbsp;
<h2>Thank you for making 2011 such a fantastic year!</h2>
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/01/Chi-FEST02.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1990" title="Chi-FEST02" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/01/Chi-FEST02.jpg" alt="" width="576" height="384" /></a> <a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/01/mztek_chi-tek_artists.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1999" title="mztek_chi-tek_artists" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/01/mztek_chi-tek_artists.jpg" alt="" width="500" height="333" /></a></p>
<span style="font-size: small;"><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-size: 12px; line-height: 18px;"><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/6031305645_b503c2253e_o.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-thumbnail wp-image-1798" title="6031305645_b503c2253e_o" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/6031305645_b503c2253e_o-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/LightPot-by-Tine-Bech-Photograph-by-Nicolai-Amter-3.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-thumbnail wp-image-1786" title="LightPot-by-Tine-Bech-Photograph-by-Nicolai-Amter-3" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/LightPot-by-Tine-Bech-Photograph-by-Nicolai-Amter-3-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/SoundMap.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-thumbnail wp-image-1791" title="SoundMap" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/SoundMap-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/TeaCosy1.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-thumbnail wp-image-1790" title="TeaCosy1" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/TeaCosy1-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Chi-TEKArtemisPapageorgiou01.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-thumbnail wp-image-1608" title="Chi-TEKArtemisPapageorgiou01" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/Chi-TEKArtemisPapageorgiou01-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/rr2.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-thumbnail wp-image-1785" title="rr2" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/rr2-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></a></span></span>

	<item>
		<title>Embroidered Digital Commons workshops at Furtherfield</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/edc_furtherfield</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 06 Mar 2012 15:15:42 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=2016</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img class="aligncenter" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/03/embroidery-main.jpg" alt="" width="598" height="300" /><a href="http://www.open-source-embroidery.org.uk/EDC.htm">Embroidered Digital Commons (EDC)</a> is currently in residency at <a href="http://www.furtherfield.org/">Furtherfield</a> until April 28 2012, when MzTEK will host the regular Saturday workshop, contributing the first techi elements to the EDC embroidery patches using soft circuitry.

Come and contribute to the epic collective EDC project this Saturday 28 April, by embroidering text from 'A Concise Lexicon of/for the Digital Commons'. We invite women to come and join us and learn some of the basics to soft circuits, adding switches and lights to your embroidered patches. This is a free workshop, but your embroidery work will become part of the collective Embroidered Digital Commons project.
<h2>When:</h2>
Saturday April 28  12pm - 3pm
<h2>Where:</h2>
Furtherfield Gallery
McKenzie Pavilion
Finsbury Park, London, N4 2NQ

<iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/14839238?title=0&amp;byline=0&amp;portrait=0" frameborder="0" width="400" height="320"></iframe>

<a href="http://vimeo.com/14839238">Rescension 2010</a>.

The <a href="http://www.open-source-embroidery.org.uk/EDC.htm">Embroidered Digital Commons</a> is a collectively stitched version of ‘A Concise Lexicon of/for the Digital Commons’ by the Raqs Media Collective (2003). The project seeks to hand-embroider the whole lexicon, term by term, through workshops and events as a practical way of close-reading and discussing the text and its current meaning.

The EDC is a distributed embroidery exploring collective work and ownership. EDC is part of the <a href="http://www.open-source-embroidery.org.uk/">Open Source Embroidery</a> project by curator and artists <a href="http://www.elecarpenter.org.uk/">Ele Carpenter</a>. Her practice investigates specific socio-political cultural contexts in collaboration with artists, makers, amateurs and experts. She is a lecturer in Curating at Goldsmiths College, University of London.

<img class="alignleft" title="EDC" src="http://www.open-source-embroidery.org.uk/osepics/Patchworkviewer.jpg" alt="" width="283" height="348" />

Since 2005 Ele has facilitated the Open Source Embroidery project using embroidery and code as a tool to investigate the language and ethics of participatory production and distribution. The Open Source Embroidery exhibition (Furtherfield, 2008; BildMuseet Umeå Sweden, 2009; Museum of Craft and Folk Art, San Francisco, 2010) presented work by over 30 artists, including the finished Html Patchwork now on display at the National Museum of Computing at Bletchley Park.  Ele is currently facilitating the ‘Embroidered Digital Commons’ a distributed embroidery exploring collective work and ownership 2008 – 2013.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Chi-TEK on exhibition at Waterman&#039;s Gallery</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/Chi-TEK_Watermans</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 06 Mar 2012 16:05:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=2037</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h1>Chi-TEK is BACK!!!!!!!!</h1>
15 of the most inspired technologically modified teapots in the world will be on display in all their interactive glory at <a href="http://www.watermans.org.uk/">Watermans Gallery</a> from 26 March to 22 April 2012.

Stay tuned for party details....
<h1><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/chitek_300.jpg"><img title="chitek_300" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/chitek_300-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/chitek_300.jpg"><img title="chitek_300" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/chitek_300-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/chitek_300.jpg"><img title="chitek_300" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/chitek_300-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></a></h1>
<div>
<p style="font-family: Georgia, 'Bitstream Charter', serif; color: #000000; line-height: 1.5em; font-size: 2.4em; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 20px; margin-left: 0px; font-weight: normal;"><a style="font-family: Georgia, 'Bitstream Charter', serif; color: #ff4b33; line-height: 1.5;" href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/SoundMap.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-thumbnail wp-image-1791" style="font-family: Georgia, 'Bitstream Charter', serif; color: #444444; line-height: 1.5; border-style: initial; border-color: initial; margin-top: 4px; margin-right: 24px; margin-bottom: 12px; margin-left: 0px; max-width: 640px; float: left; display: inline; border-width: 0px;" title="SoundMap" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/SoundMap-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></a></p>

</div>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/01082011947.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-thumbnail wp-image-1797" title="01082011947" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/01082011947-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></a><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/1.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-thumbnail wp-image-1799" title="1" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/1-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></a>
<p style="font-family: Georgia, 'Bitstream Charter', serif; line-height: 1.5em; font-size: 2.4em; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 20px; margin-left: 0px; font-weight: normal;"><a size-thumbnail wp-image-1798" style="font-family: Georgia, 'Bitstream Charter', serif; color: #444444; line-height: 1.5; border-style: initial; border-color: initial; margin-top: 4px; margin-right: <h1 style="font-family: Georgia, 'Bitstream Charter', serif; color: #000000; line-height: 1.5em; font-size: 2.4em; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 20px; margin-left: 0px; font-weight: normal;"></h1>

	<item>
		<title>Wearable Tech - LilyPad Arduino Intro</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/LilyPad_Arduino_14April</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 21 Mar 2012 13:17:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=2064</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h2>Beginners guide to the LilyPad Arduino for wearable technology.</h2>
<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/03/FashionTech_ImageByAlexFlowers_Small.jpg"><img class="aligncenter" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/03/FashionTech_ImageByAlexFlowers_Small.jpg" alt="" width="400" height="534" />
</a>

Join our one day introduction to the LilyPad Arduino and get your garments interactive!

During the course of the day you will be introduced to the basics of soft circuitry, some basic electronics, Arduino software, programming, and reading a sensor.
At the end of the day you will have a functioning interactive patch, which you can sew onto a garment, bag or cushion cover.
<h2>PLEASE BRING WITH YOU:</h2>
<ul>
	<li>A piece of fancy fabric of your choice -  it is best to use something non-stretchy and stiff, something like cotton or canvas.</li>
	<li>If you want to bring your own laptop, please make sure you have installed the latest <a href="http://arduino.cc/en/Main/Software">Arduino Software</a> on it.</li>
	<li>A <a href="http://www.amazon.co.uk/Essex-Electronics-1m-USB-2-0/dp/B001R09B2K/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&amp;qid=1332331671&amp;sr=8-1">USB to mini-USB</a>  (you are bound to have one somewhere, we thought best not to buy more ;)</li>
</ul>
<h2>Fee:</h2>
<strong>£75 +  booking fee - <strong>Includes discounted LilyPad Arduino </strong></strong>
This includes the LilyPad Arduino, LilyPad Battery Holder and FTDI board.

or

<strong>£35 +  booking fee - <strong>Not including LilyPad Arduino </strong>
</strong>This is for those who do not require a LilyPad Arduino Kit as above - There will not be spares to borrow unfortunately, please make sure you have one for the workshop if you purchase this ticket.
<h2>When</h2>
April 14th 2012
10am - 5pm
<h2>Where</h2>
SPACE
129—131 MARE STREET
LONDON E8 3RH
<h2>Tutor</h2>
Sophie McDonald is a creative technology workshop developer and educator, delivering workshops for clients such as V&amp;A, Barbican and Maker Faire. Sophie is an artist, developer, producer and co-founder of<a href="http://www.sketchpatch.net/"> sketchPatch</a> , an online computer-programming playground for coders, artists and designers - and newbies! :)
<h2>This is a women only workshop.</h2>
<h2>Sign up <a href="https://mztek.eventwax.com/wearable-tech-lilypad-arduino-workshop">HERE</a></h2>
&nbsp;

This workshop is kindly supported by

<a href="http://www.skpang.co.uk"><img class="size-full wp-image-2089 alignleft" title="skpang_logo" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/03/skpang_logo.jpg" alt="" width="190" height="48" /></a>     <a href="http://www.spacestudios.org.uk/"><img class="alignnone" title="SPACE" src="http://mztek.org/html_email/chitek_invite/images/logo_space.png" alt="" width="150" height="38" /></a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Chi-TEK Closing Party at Watermans Tonight!</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2012/04/chi-tek-closing-party-at-watermans-tonight/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 21 Apr 2012 11:18:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Em</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=2093</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>This evening is the closing party for Chi-TEK at Watermans, the perfect chance to come and see the showcase if you haven't done so already!</strong>

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/photo3.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-large wp-image-2094" title="Chi-TEK Showcase" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/photo3-1024x764.jpg" alt="" width="597" height="444" /></a>

Much like our <a href="http://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=oa.10150317060987695&amp;type=1">previous tea party</a> at the V&amp;A in September the work will be out for you to interact with and a few of the artists will also be there to discuss their work with you. The event begins at <strong>6:30pm</strong> and will finish at <strong>8:30pm</strong>. For a refresher of what you can expect in the showcase check out our <a href="http://www.mztek.org/programs/chi-tek/the-showcase/">Chi-TEK page</a>!

It is also the third installment of the Watermans<strong> International Festival of Digital Art</strong> <strong>2012</strong>, with a seminar entitled 'New Media art and illusion: physical interaction &amp; perception' which falls in-line with the opening of Michele Barker’s &amp; Anna Munster’s installation <em>HokusPokus</em>, also happening at Watermans today! For more details please <a href="http://watermans.ticketsolve.com/shows/126521636/events">read here</a>, and for info on how to get to Watermans, please look at their <a href="http://www.watermans.org.uk/contact/map--contact-info.aspx">contact page</a>.

Below are a couple of piccies of the showcase at Watermans, for more please check out our <a href="http://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=oa.10150317060987695&amp;type=1#!/media/set/?set=oa.10150707074367695&amp;type=1">Facebook page</a> - there will also be more added later after the party :)

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/IMG_4153_c.jpg"><img class="size-large wp-image-2096 aligncenter" title="Mika Satomi's 'Suicidal Teapot'" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/IMG_4153_c-1024x682.jpg" alt="" width="613" height="409" /></a> <span style="color: #808080;">Mika Satomi's <em>Suicidal Teapot </em></span>

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/IMG_4158.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-2097" title="Rain Ashford's 'Teapotty!'" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/IMG_4158-1024x682.jpg" alt="" width="621" height="413" /></a><span style="color: #999999;">Rain Ashford's <em>Teapotty!</em></span>

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/IMG_4149_c.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-2098" title="Installing the show" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/IMG_4149_c-1024x682.jpg" alt="" width="620" height="413" /></a><span style="color: #999999;">Installing the showcase</span>

	<item>
		<title>Hacked Human Orchestra - Collaboration With Guerilla Science</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/hacked-human-orchestra</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 15 May 2012 11:15:05 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Em</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=2121</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/softcircuit1.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-2126" title="Soft Circuit" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/softcircuit1.jpg" alt="" width="580" height="513" /></a>MzTEK has some exciting news! We are currently collaborating with <a href="http://guerillascience.co.uk/">Guerilla Science</a> on a project which will see a Hacked Human Orchestra brought to both <a href="http://www.wildernessfestival.com/">Wilderness</a> and <a href="http://www.shambalafestival.org/">Shambala</a> Festivals over the Summer. We will be inviting you to transform your rags to riches, hacking your outfit to create a musical instrument in a wearable technology workshop. The grand finale will be a performance led by composer Florian Lunaire, which those attending the workshop will participate in! For more information please check out Guerilla Science's website.

<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/6003191359_254bd6ec04_z1.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-2130" title="Shangri-La Glastonbury 2011 by Brendan Bell" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/6003191359_254bd6ec04_z1.jpg" alt="" width="579" height="386" /></a>Guerilla Science are renowned for their playful exploration of science, challenging negative misconceptions and creating experiences that help more people discover the unimaginable realities science reveals to us. They do this through an array of creative approaches including installations, film screenings, musical performances and games. We are so thrilled to be working with them! :)

The project is being sponsored by the Royal Academy of Engineering.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>MzTEK at Digital Shoreditch!</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/digitalshoreditch2012</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 22 May 2012 07:40:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Em</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=2152</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/LittleRobot.jpg"><img class="aligncenter  wp-image-2155" title="Mini Beetle Bot" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/LittleRobot-1024x770.jpg" alt="" width="511" height="383" /></a>

Yesterday Digital Shoreditch kicked off for its second year, celebrating the creative techiness which can be found in East London! MzTEK is very proud to be part of the festival and we'll be participating in a couple of events this week.

Today MzTEK Co-Founder, Sophie McDonald, will be talking on the 'Women in Tech' panel, part of the <a href="http://digitalshoreditch.com/innovate/">Innovate day</a> which Queen Mary University and City University London is hosting. The panel will explore how women can be better represented in the digital and technology sectors.

On Friday we'll be running a drop-in workshop at the <a href="http://digitalshoreditch.com/identity/">Identity day</a> where female delegates can create a mini beetle bot or a soft circuit voodoo ghost! This is absolutely FREE! To order your free ticket scroll down to the bottom of the <a href="http://digitalshoreditch.com/identity/">Identity day page</a>.

We hope to see you there! :)]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>FLOSSIE! Women in Open Source Soft &amp; Hardware</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2012/05/flossie-women-in-open-source-soft-hardware/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 23 May 2012 13:33:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=2177</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/FLOSSIE.png"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-2179" title="FLOSSIE" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/FLOSSIE.png" alt="" width="579" height="172" /></a>

MzTEK will be taking part in the women's open source conference  <a href="http://www.flossie.org">FLOSSIE</a> this <a href="http://www.flossie.org/?page_id=125">Friday 25 and Saturday 26 May</a> at Queen Mary University.

On Friday at 3.50pm we will be presenting our amazing Chi-TEK tea party project we delivered last year in the V&amp;A garden. For more details on the project click on the teapot on the left (or <a href="http://www.mztek.org/programs/chi-tek/">here</a>).
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/01/mztek_chi-tek_artists.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1999 aligncenter" title="mztek_chi-tek_artists" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/01/mztek_chi-tek_artists-300x199.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="199" /></a></p>
On Saturday, 2.30pm, we will join up with Embroidered Digital Commons to contribute some soft circuits to the epic collective embroidering of the text from 'A Concise Lexicon of/for the Digital Commons'.
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/03/embroidery-main.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-medium wp-image-2017" title="embroidery-main" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/03/embroidery-main-300x150.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="150" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: left;">We invite women to come and <a href="http://flossie2012.eventbrite.co.uk/">join us</a> and learn some of the basics to soft circuits, adding switches and lights to your embroidered patches. This is a free workshop, but your embroidery work will become part of the collective Embroidered Digital Commons project.</p>
FLOSSIE is a free conference, so sign up and spend the day with a bunch of like minded women, and attend workshops in Arduino, soft circuits, and learn about Free/Libre Open-source Software (FLOSS).
<h2>WHERE</h2>
<a href="http://www.flossie.org/?page_id=291">Conference venue at Queen Mary University, Mile End</a> - in the maths building.
<h2>Check out the programme <a href="http://www.flossie.org/?page_id=125">here</a>.</h2>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Arduino Basics At Access Space - Sheffield</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2012/05/arduino-basics-at-access-space-sheffield/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 30 May 2012 12:37:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=2187</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/arduino_workshopBubbleMachineSmall.png">
<img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-2189" title="arduino_workshopBubbleMachineSmall" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/arduino_workshopBubbleMachineSmall.png" alt="" width="500" height="410" /></a>

Interaction designer <a href="http://katrinbaumgarten.de/">Katrin Baumgarten</a> will guide you through the steps to making a simple interactive bubble machine using an <a href="http://www.arduino.cc/">Arduino</a>, sensors, electronics and some programming.

This workshop will give you enough knowledge to get you started creating all kninds of interactive crazyness... such as Katrin's tea pot <a href="http://katrinbaumgarten.de/thisthat/raging-roger-the-spitting-teapot/">Raging Roger!</a>, commissioned by MzTEK for <a href="http://www.mztek.org/programs/chi-tek/">Chi-TEK</a>.

<a href="http://katrinbaumgarten.de/">Katrin Baumgarten</a> holds an MA from the Royal College of Art and an MSc from Imperial College London in Innovation Design Engineering. Her projects revolve around human-technology interaction and explore future possibilities within technology and art. She loves to see the magic that appears when an inanimate object suddenly starts to move and respond to external stimuli in ways normally attributed to humans.

This workshop is suitable for beginners, so just come and have a try, and most of all, fun!
<h2>WHERE</h2>
<a href="http://access-space.org/">Access Space</a>
3-7 Sidney Street
Sheffield
S1 4RG
<h2>WHEN</h2>
Saturday 9 June, 2012
10am - 5pm
<h2>Sign up! it's FREE!!!!!!!</h2>
<strong>This workshop is a women only workshop... and it's FREE! <strong>- so you've got nothing to lose!</strong>
<strong><strong><strong>To book a place c</strong></strong>ontact Access Space on <strong>44 (0)114 2495522 </strong></strong></strong>

This workshop is supported by <a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/logo.png"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-2196" title="logo" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/logo.png" alt="" width="311" height="106" /></a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Dorkbot Sheffield</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2012/05/dorkbot-sheffield/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 30 May 2012 13:24:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=2206</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h1 style="text-align: center;"><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/02/header.jpg"><img class="aligncenter  wp-image-106" title="header" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/02/header.jpg" alt="" width="576" height="44" /></a></h1>
<h1 style="text-align: center;"></h1>
<h1 style="text-align: center;"></h1>
&nbsp;
<h1 style="text-align: center;">will be presenting at</h1>
&nbsp;
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/dorkbot_logo.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-2210" title="dorkbot_logo" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/dorkbot_logo.jpg" alt="" width="385" height="71" /></a><em>
"people doing strange things with electricity"</em></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><img class="aligncenter  wp-image-2216" title="dorbot_sheffield" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/dorbot_sheffield.png" alt="" width="464" height="165" /></p>

<h1 style="text-align: center;"><a href="http://dorkbotsheffield.lurk.org/dorkbotsheffield-5/">#5</a></h1>
<h1 style="text-align: center;"></h1>
&nbsp;
<h1 style="text-align: center;">7pm, Friday 8 June 2012</h1>
<h1 style="text-align: center;">@</h1>
&nbsp;
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="http://access-space.org/"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-2196" title="logo" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/logo.png" alt="" width="311" height="106" /></a></p>

<h1 style="text-align: center;"> Come and hear how we got started and what we get up to, + a short video about the Chi-TEK Tea Party.
<strong>
</strong></h1>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>2206</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2012-05-30 13:24:53</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2012-05-30 13:24:53</wp:post_date_gmt>

	<item>
		<title>Hacked Human Orchestra</title>
		<link>http://www.mztek.org/2012/06/hacked-human-orchestra/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 08 Jun 2012 10:09:54 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sophie</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.mztek.org/?p=2244</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/speakerx400.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-2250" title="My beautiful picture" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/speakerx400.jpg" alt="" width="400" height="300" /></a>

Electronic instruments, sonic soft-circuits, mechanical melodies… our take on ‘live music performance’!

MzTEK is joining forces with <a href="http://guerillascience.co.uk/">Guerilla Science</a> to produce the most amazing Hacked Human Orchestra EVER!

We have teamed up with PhD Media Arts and Technology Engineer Shauna Concannon and artists <a href="www.kobakant.at">Kobakant</a> to design the wearable instruments and workshops.

Join in the fun in our soft-circuit synth workshop.

Learn some basic electronics and how to make a soft-circuit synthesiser you can wear. You will be lead through the process of creating different types of sound circuits, which will then be integrated into festival goers clothing at <a href="www.shambalafestival.org/">Shambala</a> and <a href="wildernessfestival.com/">Wilderness</a> in August. You will be given workshop instructions and gain the knowhow for making them at home.

If you attend the festivals in August, you can sign up to complete your wearable instrument there, and join in the orchestrated evening performance.
<h2>Where</h2>
<a href="http://www.creativecollaboration.org.uk/where.php">Centre for Creative Collaboration
</a>16 Acton Street London Greater London WC1X 9NG
<h2>When</h2>
June 30 2012
10am - 5pm
<h2>Only £8! Sign Up NOW!</h2>
This is a women only workshop.<strong> Sign up <a href="https://mztek.eventwax.com/hacked-human-orchestra-">HERE</a></strong>

<a href="http://guerillascience.co.uk/"><img class="size-full wp-image-2257 alignleft" title="gs_logo_bwSmall" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/gs_logo_bwSmall.jpg" alt="" width="200" height="170" /></a> <a href="http://www.mztek.org/wp-admin/www.kobakant.at"><img class="size-full wp-image-2258 alignleft" title="kobakant" src="http://www.mztek.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/kobakant.jpg" alt="" width="240" height="139" /></a>]]></content:encoded>
